dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A battered sneaker tattooed with doodles of speeding cars and checkered flags and the words "Start Your Engines!" Beats up and down, a sewing machine needle of anxious, restless, adolescent energy. A pencil fills in the oval of a standardized test form, then hesitates, twitching with the speed of a humming bird wing caught between two fingers, then is quickly erased as a different answer is chosen. The form sheet is filled with smudges of uncertainty. A ten year old boy stares at the next question.

dialogues.speaker: TEST QUESTION
dialogues.text: Grace buys a bag of 240 jellybeans. There are 35 yellow ones, 52 red ones, 63 green ones, 26 white ones, 41 blue ones and 40 black ones. If Grace wants to eat one of each while keeping her eyes closed, what is the minimum number she will have to eat? His mouth tries to makes sense of the question but it's not working. He looks around at the other students quietly, diligently filling in their ovals while he fidgets, his leg beating, his pencil fluttering, a pot jiggling its lid, about to boil over. He reads the question again. Greek. Chinese. Meaningless. He looks up at the clock. The second hand sweeps towards the 12. Then back at the test. Something suddenly clicks. He stares at the clock, pencil poised, waiting until the second hand hits the 12 and he's off- Filling in the ovals faster than it seems he could possibly be reading the questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Racer sits across the desk from Speed's teacher.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: No, that's not exactly right. Your son seems to be interested in only one thing. Mom knows what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All he talks about, all he seems capable of thinking about is automobile racing.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Well you know, his father designs racing cars.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: And where is your husband?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: He's-working. He couldn't make it.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Perhaps the apple hasn't fallen very far from the tree. Mom is uncomfortable with that truth while the Teacher glances back to her records.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is your husband's name Rex?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: No, Rex is his older brother. Why?

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: This is the test he turned in last week. She holds up the Scantron test that Speed was working on. The bottom half of the ovals are filled in to spell out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed has finished filling in the test and is now drawing pictures in the corner of the test booklet. He is drawing little race cars,. He flips a few of the pages and we see a quick moment of his animation as two cars collide.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He continues to draw as the background of the classroom fades to white behind him, becoming the black corner that he is drawing on. We watch the race going on in his head as hand-drawn cars battle each other heading for a photo-finish. Speed makes the car noise himself including the jumping sound as two cars try to block the Mach 5, smashing into one another as -- The Mach 5 jumps over and through the fiery crash, crossing the finish line still in the air. Speed is lost in slow-motion revelry, making the sound of the roaring crowd. The teacher hears him and looks up, frowning as she sees him lost in his fantasy world. A little girl with a pink barrette also hears him turning to watch him, a smile creeping across her face; there is no one in the entire school like him. The teacher is about to say something when the bell rings. Speed snaps out of his fantasy and leaps up, in motion before anyone else.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: Alright, pencils down, bring your

dialogues.speaker: TESTS--
dialogues.text: Thwack! Speed slaps his down and is already heading for the door.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: --to my desk. Ham! The door slams open and Speed shoots out.

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speed Racer, slow down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed slides down the railing on his butt, a perpetual motion machine as he scans the street, smiling as he sees Across the street, leaning against his hot rod, his big brother, Rex Racer.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He pauses crossing the street letting two impossibly cool cars pass by. Here we begin to see the unique and individualized nature of the automobile in the world of Speed Racer. In this world, the grocery store parking lot looks like a car collector show; vintage and concept cars are as ubiquitous as the Camry is in our world. Speed dashes across the street, a tight parabolic arc around the car, his little head sticking up like a shark fin circling until-- The car door pops open and snaps shut. The seat-belt clicks into place before Rex even has a chance to move. He leans over and looks in the window. Speed smiles.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: .I take it you're ready to go? Speed nods. Rex climbs in beside him.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, who was school?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPEED
dialogues.text: Fine. Are you going to the track? Mom said you were. You don't have to drop me off, I could just go with you.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: No way. He starts the car and roadster growls to life.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPEED
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, take me with you. Come on, please.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I can't, Speed. Pops would kill me.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPEED
dialogues.text: He doesn't have to know. I won't say anything. Nobody will know. Come on, please, Rex, pleaseplease pleasepleasepleeeease. Rex sighs, knowing there's no way he can with this.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Are you wearing the socks? Lickety-split, Speed sticks his sneaker up against the dash board and pulls back his pant leg revealing-- A bright red sock.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You roll us again and this'll be the last time? Deal? A ten year old's grin spreads ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPEED
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone figure sits on a bench away from us; his racing suit is unzipped to the waist and he sits with his head down as though he was praying. He is wearing a pair of bright red socks. After a moment, he pulls his boots on, zips up his suit and stands looking into the locker. Propped against this gloves is a photo of Rex. This is Speed ten years later. He takes the photo and slides it into one of the zippered pockets of his suit. He grabs his gloves and slams the locker shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first gen T-180 screams along the metal raceway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed sits in Rex's lap, wearing a too-big helmet, giggling with a child's mad glee as he steers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car.banks up a wall and roars down, swooping past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed screeches as though riding a roller coaster.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Feel that shimmy? That's your hind legs trying to outrun you're front.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What do I do?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Stop steering and start driving. Speed gets serious, his lips tightening the way a hand knots into a fist.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This ain't no dead piece a metal. A car's a living breathing thing. She's alive. You can feel her talking to you, telling you what she wants, what she needs. You just gotta listen. Speed tries to listen.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close your eyes and listen. Speed does.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They say that Ben burns drove the last lap of the '68 Vanderbilt Cup with his eye closed.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: No? Well maybe you can't hear it then. Maybe. you ought to start hitting those books--

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: No! I hear it!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: That so? Okay Mr. Burns, you tell me when to gas it for the jump.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Speed concentrates..

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Uh-uh. The jump glides towards them as the tires seem to whisper to Speed.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now! Rex smiles, hitting the gas, launching the car into the air where it seems to hang fora moment before rushing down at us as we cut--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The modern T-180's come flying overhead, slamming down against the metal track, scattering bright bursts of shooting sparks in their wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long stretch of identical glass cubicles that look down at the raceway, where announcer's from all over the globe provide color commentary for race fans. Thunderhead is a relatively small track and the media-row should reflect that while it's big enough to be covered in several different languages, it is not nearly as important as the majors.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --local fan favorite, Speed racer is just gobbling up this track, slipping car after car--

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD LEDERMAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --no one seems able to lay a glove on this kid--

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --clearly a rising star, with several big wins since turning pro, though he remains without a major sponsor--

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --a win tonight could put him within range of qualifying for the Grand Prix--

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --let us hope he does not make the same mistakes that his older brother made--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the cockpit of a racing car that feels more like a fighter jet, Speed does the thing he was born to do. Though the vibrations are enough to rattle molars loose, there is a calmness, a preternatural ease in Speed's manner that suggests this maelstrom of velocity is where he belongs. He hears a voice in his headset.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Head's up,.Speed! Seven o'clock. I got Snake drafting.Pitter-pat. Speed looks into his mirror and sees a car with orange and black markings, stacked up tight behind another car.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is smaller than a typical crew pit since the cars don't really pit. There is a panel like a sound mixing board filled with needled gauges and green-barred light meters. Sparky is watching through binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: I figure he'll slingshot after you in the next turn.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars explode into the next turn when Snake uses the draft to slingshot by the car ahead of him-- Hurling like a bullet straight at Speed as-- Speed thumbs a button on his steering wheel causing jacks to shoot out of the bottom of the car and sending it up into the air just as-- Snake flies under it, careening into the bottom of the turn too tightly, bouncing of the rail, out of control, ricochetting back at Speed as-- He turns his wheels, catching a part of Snake's car with the grace of a bull-fighter, sending it spinning away towards the other cars while-- Speed rockets free-- Eliciting a huge roar from the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Great move, Speed. Careful on the butterfly coming up. You may wanna ease up--

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Not this time, Sparky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed careens through a butterfly turn like there was a slot-guide in the track causing another crowd roar. They can feel that something special might be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky checks his stop watch.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Holy canoli, Speed, You know who you're racing?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He can see him.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Yeah... Just ahead, the ghost of his brother's car launches up the second jump and when ti comes down we are back in the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex drives the older model T-180, a man on a mission, dominating the race exactly like Speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops stands watching the race through binoculars Young Spped is beside him.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPEED
dialogues.text: Rex's gonna win, ain't he, Pops? Pops checks his watch but almost can't believe it. He goes back to his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He's gonna win it. He's gonna set the course record. Nobody's gonna catch him.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Quiet, Speed! There's a lotta race to run.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPPED
dialogues.text: No way. It's over. My brother's the best racer in the world. Everybody else is running for second. The cars rocket through the twisted mobius of steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blackjack Benelli grabs one of the crew chief, knotting his fists in the fabric of the path-covered cover alts.

dialogues.speaker: BLACKJACK BENELLI
dialogues.text: I told you to take him out!

dialogues.speaker: CREW CHIEF
dialogues.text: We're trying, sir. He's just too fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex blazes by, the track rattling like a metal roller- coaster, opening an even bigger lead. As we move around Rex's car, we see suddenly there is someone right behind him, a ghost car-- Speed. As Speed makes his move, he pulls us back into the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzz is palpable.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --it's unbelievable folks, no one's seen moves like this, since that remarkable night eight years

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD LEDERMAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --there's no doubt in my mind, he's gunning for it--

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --driving like a man possessed, a man haunted by his past---

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --a record that has stood for eight years set by.his,older--

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --he is not alone out there, he is chasing someone, he is chasing the ghost of Rex Racer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the glass of Pop's binos we can see the dim reflection of the two brothers racing.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Pops stands beside Mom. He is still watching the race with his trusty binos though he is now a little older, plumper and balder.. He clicks his stopwatch, checking it at the same time that Sprittle checks his. Sprittle stands on the chair next to him.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Jeepers, he could do it, Pops. He could really do it, couldn't he? Pops goes back to his binos.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What if he does? What if he does it, Pops?

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Sssh!

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can watch this... He holds the binos as though afraid to look when-- A hairy hand comes in and takes them away. Chim-chim, sitting on the chair next to Sprittle, puts the binos to his eyes. Speed flies through a piece of tricky track drawing another cheer. Sprittle grabs the binos back just as the beautiful young woman, standing on the other side of Pops, lowers her. Trixie chews at her lip, feeling a knot twist into her gut.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. SUBURBAN STREET- DAY
dialogues.text: The little girl wearing the pink barrette is walking with a pack of girls, their little mouths as sharp as razors. In the distance we hear a high-pitched motorized whine.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE PACK LEADER
dialogues.text: My Daddy told me he used to work for the Mishida Motorwerks but he quit. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE PACK LEADER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My daddy said that was a completely crazy thing to do. He says the whole family is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Speed's not crazy.

dialogues.speaker: BLONDE PACK LEADER
dialogues.text: No, he's just dumb. Probably the dumbest kid in class. Ms. Waterstraat had me alphabetize the IRB tests and you wouldn't believe what that retard did-- Sock! Trixie decks her to the shock of the rest of the pack just as the whine grows very loud and-- Speed comes rounding the bend on a little go-cart, wearing his too-big helmet making his big head seem ridiculously enormous. Zipping past, he suddenly notices the girl in the pink barrette standing over another girl; there is something about her-- Maybe it's way she's got her fists up, like a boy, or maybe it's the. way her jaw is set, ready to take on

dialogues.speaker: ANYONE--
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, when their eyes suddenly meet, he finds he is unable to look away-- Staring at her, as he drives off the road, crashing through a hedge and tumbling down a hill.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Speed! She runs to help him. He is laying sprawled out, his car on its side, wheels still spinning.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you alright? He's a bit groggy.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .who are you?

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I'm Trixie. I'm in your class.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .oh .yeah. He stares at her for a minute, powder-puffs of clouds floating about her head.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He, would you like to see my car

dialogues.speaker: COLLECTION
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops and Rex are working on the T-180. Rex is in a wife- beater, up to his elbows in axel grease. The sound of an angry bee hive fills the room as Speed drives up through the big open door.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Hey, Rex. Hey Pops.

dialogues.speaker: RE X
dialogues.text: Hey, Speedy.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Who's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Her name's Trixie. She's in my class.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you, young lady.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Hey pops, a guy wanted me to give this to you. He said he was a big fan. He hands him the package and Pops smiles.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: A fan, is it? Not often we get someone with such good taste around here. Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: He was in a hurry. Driving a '68 Fendersin. Sweet set. of wheels. The car description rings a bell for Rex.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Let me see that. He grabs the box, then holds it to his ear. It's ticking. He jams it into the go-cart, against the pedal and slaps it in reverse. The go--.cart shoots out of the garage and down the driveway until-- It explodes, an enormous fireball ballooning up past the tree tops. Trixie's eyes flash with excitement.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Cool beans!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling the storm of emotions that she knows Speed must be feeling, she takes a deep breath and raises the binos back up. Through the magnifying lenses we see Speed flying around the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are riding the story like Speed is driving the track.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --no one from these parts will forget the tragic story of Rex

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD LEDERMAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --he nearly ruined racing--

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --single-handedly tried to save

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --one of the greatest scandals in the history of the sport--

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --it is always the brightest star that burn out the fastest--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed blister through the high-banked slalom and it seems at first that he is all alone but then we see the trace effect as we realize that the two cars are making perfectly identical moves until-- They bank into a straightaway, splitting apart, like a shadow suddenly cut free as both cars accelerate-- Neck and neck, the past a mirror of the present.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG SPEED, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Can I go with you, Re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Speed watches as Rex packs his bags.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: Not this time, Speedy.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: When are you coming back?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't know. He snaps the bag shut.

dialogues.speaker: REX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, Speed... one day people might say things about me. No matter what they say, I hop... I just hope you never believe them.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I won't. He hugs his little brother, knowing it might be for the last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex heads for the door but Pops is waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: So, you're quitting?

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I have to.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: No you don't. This is a choice. You're selling out, walking away from everything we've built here.

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: I'm done arguing with you Pops. He turns back towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Don't you walk away from me!

dialogues.speaker: REX
dialogues.text: You can't tell me what to do. It's my life to live. He takes hold of the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: If you walk out that door, you better not ever come back! The door slams in response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed and the ghost of his brother cross, switching positions as the memories come faster and faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed sits on the floor, glued to the television,

dialogues.speaker: ON
dialogues.text: watching a big race that Rex is in. Mom and Pops are the couch behind him. All of them sit in.a suspended state, a fist of tension squeezing the breath out of them. One the screen, is a cloud of smoke billowing from a tangle of metal.

dialogues.speaker: RALLY ANNOUNCER, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Rex Racer riving the black and red Uniron car, got in a tangle with Richenhbach, who had been favored to win--

dialogues.speaker: COLOR ANNOUNCER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That was no tangle, he took Richenbach out--

dialogues.speaker: RALLY ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: We don't know that but I imagine the WRL will be reviewing this crash.

dialogues.speaker: COLOR ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: That's the third DNF crash Racer's been involved in! Review it? Heck, the oughta just suspend him.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Turn it off, Speed! I don't want you watching this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed tightens his grip on the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed is hidden beneath the blankets, the sound of a small portable television barely audible.

dialogues.speaker: RACE ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Rex Racer almost took Yokima's head off wit that jump!

dialogues.speaker: RACE COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: There's absolutely no doubt in my mind that Rex Racer is the dirtiest driver in the world. Lit by the soft glow of the small tv, Speed blinks and the first tears slip silently down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His jaw locks, as he remains trapped between two different forces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Speed is clobbering a kid who is twice his size. A teacher finally pulls them apart.

dialogues.speaker: BIG MOUTH
dialogues.text: I just told him the truth! His crum-bum brother doesn't belong on a racetrack-- he belongs in jail! Speed tears free and torpedoes Big Mouth again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cars continue to dance around each other.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --the trial of Rex Racer shook the World Racing League to tis very

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD LEDERMAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --once a rat, always a rat and in my book Rex Racer's nuthin' but a

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --the indictment brought down perennial racing powerhouse

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --Uniroyal was linked to the notorious fixer Blackjack Benelli--

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --still in prison to this day, Benelli was rumored to be behind the Casa Cristo tragedy-- The two cars swerve, heading for a collision as we cut--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, Pops, Sparky, Trixie and Speed are all watching the race on the television.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Something happens and Mom drops her glass. It shatters but no one seems to notice. Young Speed is transfixed by the horror of what is playing out, the images of fire and flashing lights, reflecting in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CASA CRISTO ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: This has to be one of the worst crashes I have ever seen--

dialogues.speaker: CASA CRISTO COMMENTATOR
dialogues.text: Terrible, just terrible---

dialogues.speaker: CASA CRISTO ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: There is still no sign of the driver, Rex Racer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed presses down on the accelerator and starts to gain, fighting the emotion welling behind his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Held by his mother, Speed sobs and sobs while Pops stands helplessly at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed again pulls even with Rex as the finish line comes into view.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --he's comin'hard, it's gonna be

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD LEDERMAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --forget the past, he's sayin', this is my night--

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --there's a new Racer in town--

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --poised to wipe the slate clean--

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --escaping the dark shadow of his older brother-- The checkered flag goes up, ready as the two cars come screaming towards the finish line-- The large digital clock seemingly synchronized with the past as--. Speed looks over at the ghost car, the faintest smile on his lips as he sees his older brother and then-- Takes his foot off the accelerator, letting Rex's car surge ahead, crossing just before Speed. The time is just over the record causing disappointment to ripple through the crowd except for-- The Racer family who seem both relived and happy.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Come on, Let's go! Victory Lane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seem exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Zut alors! What a race!

dialogues.speaker: CHINESE ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --by a cat's whisker--

dialogues.speaker: AUSTRALIAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --the record still stands--

dialogues.speaker: HAROLD LEDERMAN ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --looked like he pulled up to me--

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: --Folks, I knew Rex Racer and if he's up there somewhere watching this race, you can bet your ass, he's damn proud of his little brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walls of glass overlooking a galaxy of.twinkling cityscape; a penthouse created as a diamond is created, every face a perfect stroke of precision.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A beautiful woman wearing nerdy-glasses sits watching the television from the leather banquette. She has a body made of the same kind of lines that a sports car or a high-heel has, lines that make your head turn. This is Minx. Beside her is a brooding, muscled man, his attention we don't riveted as Speed pulls into Victory Lane. Though see his face, this is Racer X.

dialogues.speaker: MINX
dialogues.text: He' going to be very good.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: No. He's going to be the best. The crowd swarms around Speed's car.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If they don't destroy him first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is ringing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: to the Mom is. cooking breakfast. Before she can get phone, Sprittle grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Racer residence.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORATE AGENT
dialogues.text: Good morning, I was hoping to speak with Speed racer.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: He's not interested. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Sprittle!

dialogues.speaker: SPR ITTLE
dialogues.text: It's true!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: That's not for you to say.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Speed's gotta drive for Pops!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: That's for Speeed to decide. The phone rings again. Sprittle grabs it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: CORPORATE AGENT
dialogues.text: Is this the Racer residence? He glances at Mom.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Nope. He hangs up. Shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wrong number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops is doing his exercises in his gray sweats.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: Speed now sleeps in Rex's old room. The poster of Burns is still tacked to the wall above the bed. Mom opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Come on, Champ. Rise and shine. Breakfast's ready. to the Speed's hair.seems to remain asleep, still molded pillow as he tries to push himself up.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .I'm up, I'm up.

dialogues.speaker: THE
dialogues.text: Mom spatulas another short stack of pancakes from griddle and shovels them like coal into the blazing maw of a locomotive, dumping them onto the plates of Sprittle and Chim-chim.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They eat ravenously, trying to secretly steal food from each other's plates while Pops reads from the Racing News.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: "It was a virtuoso display of talent, the likes of which has not been seen at Thunderhead since Racer the elder dropped jaws eight. years ago. Now, as we once again, pull our collective jaws up from the floor, we have to ask, will it be different this time, or will

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: That's enough of that, Hon. Pops puts down the paper and Sparky picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: I just can't believe there wasn't one mention of Racer motors in there.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: That's because the Sponsors run the media, Sparky. Trixie enters through the back door.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Mornin' everyone. Is Speed up yet? Speed stumbles in the door.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .in spirit anyway.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Hey superstar, did you see the papers? They're all in love with you.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Really? He sits, grabbing the paper.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Yeah, but there sure is a lot of speculation about which team's going to pick him up

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .really? Speed starts to read and suddenly the room begins to rumble, glasses shaking, plates rattling.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What the--?

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Earthquake! He and Chim-chim begin wailing in panic.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Quick, under the table! Into the door-frame!

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Sprittle calm down!

dialogues.speaker: SPEEED
dialogues.text: Pops the kitchen's the most dangerous room in a house during an earthquake! The whole table shivers and it seems the hanging ceiling light might shake free when the tremor begins to subside. Sprittle and Chim-chim, wearing a pot and a metal colander for protection, look around, expecting something bad to happen. The house becomes pin-prick quiet when-- The doorbell rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops opens the door to a face full of turbine exhaust from the private K-Harrier jet parked on their front lawn. On their doorstep is an extremely well dressed older man carrying a bouquet of flowers and box of cigars. His smile is as bright and shiny as a surgeon's scalpel. He says, "Good morning, Mr. And Mrs. Racer" but no once can hear him over the howl of the turbines. He gestures, asking permission to come in. Pops lets him by and closes the door, immediately reducing the noise.

dialogues.speaker: WELL DRESSED MAN
dialogues.text: Mr. And Mrs. Racer, I hope you will forgive this imposition. He hands her the beautiful bouquet of flowers.

dialogues.speaker: WELL DRESSED MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These are Blue-belles from EDEN Inc. I'm told the will bloom at least three times, each time a different color. .Mom "ohhhs" her appreciation, while he hands over the bo of cigars.

dialogues.speaker: WELL DRESSED MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Mr. Racer these are for you, straight form the Isle of Kamut. Hand-rolled. Premium blend. They glance at each other, a bit takenaback.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Uh, thanks but... who are you? He seems to rise up an inch taller as he introduces himself.

dialogues.speaker: WELL DRESSED MAN
dialogues.text: I am E.P. Arnold Remmingtonton Esquire, President and Chairman of Remmington Industries and it is my honor to meet you both. He reaches for Pops' free hand.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Mr. Racer, I have been an ardent admirer of your work for years. I remember the first time I saw the prototype for the Mach-1, I told everyone that it didn't belong on a race track, it belonged in an art museum. Pops chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Yeah, she was a beaut.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: No, sir. She was a revelation. He suddenly smells the pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, dear. I interrupted your breakfast. Is that pancakes, I smell?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Are you hungry, Mr. Remmington?

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: A figure like mine requires constant attention, Mrs. Racer.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Do you like pancakes?

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: When I was a child we used to say, "pankuken zin liesben." Neither of them speak German.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pancakes are love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington stuff another forkful into his mouth and moans his appreciation. Sprittle and Chim--chim sit on either side of him, their gunsel eyes train on his every move.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Gorgeous, Mrs. Racer. Superb density. Hints of vanilla. Cinnamon. Absolutely gorgeous.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I'm glad you like them.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Like them? I want to-buy your recipe. He takes out his hand held computer and beings making notes.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I can give you the recipe, Mr. Remmington.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Nonsense. Cenestro Foods, a sub- division of Remmington Industries is planning a new range of home- cooked meals for travelers and this is just the kind of magic we're looking for. I'll have my attorney draw up the paperwork. Mom looks at Pops feeling flattered but again a distinct discomfort.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now, then. We all know the reason I'm here is because of you, Speed. I was watching last night and I have to tell you young man, you gave me goosebumps. I know at once, this was no mere driver I was watching. This was an artist. Speed's ears go a bit red.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Driver's only as good as the car.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I appreciate modesty, Speed but I do not exaggerate when is ay that you are a genius. Watching you reminded me of why I love racing and I am grateful for that. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: You're welcome, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I imagine the phone has been ringing off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Speed's not interest in driving for you or any other sponsor.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Is this your manager then?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: He's our youngest. Sprittle.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, youngster.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Remmington offers his hand but Sprittle doesn't take it.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: We got out eye on you, Mister.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Excellent. The first thing I want to make perfectly clear is that I have no intention whatsoever of trying to get Speed away from Racer motors. What you have here is what teams spend years and millions of dollars trying to achieve: chemistry. Car designer, mechanic and driver all coming together in perfect, harmony. I wouldn't dare touch a thing.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Well, excuse me for asking, but what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: To help. I want to make sure you have access to whatever resources you need to continue doing exactly what you are doing.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: I assume, Mr. Remmington that you are not talking about philanthropy. Remmington chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I like when my partners have a sense of humor. And that's what I'm talking about. A partnership. An alliance between your amazing family and mine. That's exactly what Remmington Industries is to me, a family. Like yours. Just a little bigger. Pops isn't exactly buying it.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: No offense, Remmington but Racer Motors runs as an independent.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: None taken. I completely understand. I sympathize. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Strike that-- I sympathize. You may think of R. I. As a huge corporate conglomerate but I will have you know sire, that I still remember working all night on a Commodore 64 in the basement of my foster parents' home. I build R.I. From below the ground up. So while Remmington Industries may look like a Major Sponsor to you, it remains in my heart as independent to me as the first day I quit my job at GloBocom to work for myself. They're 're stunned into silence, while Remmington presses on.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I've had this wonderful opportunity to meet your family. All I am asking is for you to please give me the chance to introduce you to.mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The K-Harrier drifts through the polygonal mountain range where glittering minarets of steel and glass crown towering cathedrals of commerce. Helicopters swarm like pollinating bees in summer field. The vista is filled with the icons of every conceivable business in very conceivable language. It is a landscape that merges the pop-art sensibility of Warhol with the urban sprawl of Blade Runner. INT. K-HARRIER. Wood paneled elegance surround the family who sit in overstuffed seats as soft and padded as clouds. They can't help but gawk out the windows as they float through the city.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I've never flown so low through the city.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Special permit. Only six of them are granted a year.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sprittle and Chim-chim are gawking at something else: the vertical pull-out drawer lined with every kind candy in the world.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Take whatever you like. He looks at her for a moment like is in love, then turns back to the drawer where he and Chim-chim lunge for it, pushing each other back.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Sprittle!

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: She said we could! Pop growls at him, his eyes telling them they'd better not take more than one piece. Hang-dogged heads, they each grab one piece of candy?

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Thank you. She closes the drawer, their eyes seen through the racks, watching paradise disappear as though a mirage.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Hey, there's the Grand Prix Coliseum! Sprittle and Chim-chim rush to Sparky's window. They can see the entire track and even from this height it seems enormous. Sprittle turns to Remmington.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: My brother's going to win the Grand Prix one day. Remmington's eyes glint.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: No doubt in my mind; young man. Given the right circumstances, I have no doubt whatsoever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power gleams off every surface and line of the strata- scape. The K-Harrier glides gracefully down to the private landing pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An entourage of assistants wait like puppies at the door. Among them is a gorgeous woman with the kind of smile that puts people immediately at ease.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: This is Gennie. She's our Talent Manager. Ask for anything, her job's to make it come true.

dialogues.speaker: GENNIE
dialogues.text: Hi, Speed. Welcome to Remmington. He shakes her hand while she signals to another man who immediately begins scanning speed with an electronic measuring device.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: To make an informed decision you'll need to understand how we take care of our drivers. The tailor finishes quickly as an electric cart, the kind designed for a group tour pulls up.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All abroad.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Cool!. They climb on and the driver pulls into the tramway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These well lit hallways are extra wide with lots of colored guide lines on the floor like. in a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There are a lot of signs, directional and advertisements hawking the widely varied Remmington products. The red lines lead to doors emblazoned with "Restricted Access." There is a fair bit of hustle and bustle, like a busy street as golf carts, seg-ways and motorized scooter zip to and fro. No one walks.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Remmington Tower is the crown jewel among the properties that I control. It functions as the corporate headquarters for he top twelve divisions of our parent corp. One big industries family. The turn a corner heading for a large set of doors with the double "R" logo of Remmington Racecars.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of all the 143 companies that I control, none of them is as dear to my heart as the T-180 division. The door opens as they enter---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars from the golden Age through to the present surround the pathway, dangling in midair or mounted in situ- dioramas, each carefully lit with spotlights like works of art or precious gems.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I've always felt that it is impossible to peer into the window of Tomorrow without a clear view of the Past.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: That's the Crystal Horse with the Apache Super--Charger!

dialogues.speaker: REMINGTON
dialogues.text: Winner of the Grand Prix in '69, ' 70 and '73.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: No. Wrong. '72. '71 was the Vundervopper with the K-2 twin turbine and '73 was the Kenobe Motorstar re-built with a VC ;triple chamber. Remmington considers arguing.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Don't bother. He's never wrong. They pass out of the museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall widens allowing a special lane that leads out onto an observation deck that over looks the main T-180 factory. The bank of windows overlooks the enormous facility. It is a state of the art assembly line that rises vertically, instead of horizontally. The chassis arrives at the bottom and is born up by a mechanical arm, rotating as each platform assembles the next piece. The far wall is nothing but glass providing a sun- drappled_vista of Cosmopolis.

dialogues.speaker: REMINGTON
dialogues.text: Our vertically integrated plant is the fastest in the world. From initial carbon bond to finished car in 36 hours. How long does it take at Racer Motors?

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Several weeks at least. Remmington turns to Pops.

dialogues.speaker: REMINGTON
dialogues.text: This kind of production facility could be at your disposal, Mr. Racer. The cart motor hums and slides back onto the tramway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next viewing stage is a window into the vacuumed- sealed laboratory where they construct the "engine" that powers the T-180's turbine. It looks like an operating theatre with several robotic arms and a cluster of auto-surgeons operating inside sealed perspec chambers.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: This is our operating theater where our patented Refusion Energy Distributor Network is installed in the turbine drive. Sparky's eye light up.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Is that an inner-positive transponder?

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: It is indeed. Sparky shoots a look at Pops.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We control the only transponder foundry in the world outside of Mushi Motors in Taiobi. The window suddenly turns into a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oops. Sorry. Trade Secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cart arrives at an elevator station, and the driver presses a signal control the doors opening immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver punches in a floor and door direction code (north, south, east, west) and the elevator begins to rise while the dais in the floor begins to spin aligning them with a different door.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Now, I'll take you up to the Team Remmington training facility. The west door opens and the cart glides out into a new tramway which is not as industrial feeling as the first one, decorated with a vinyl wainscotting and slightly up- graded lights. The higher you go in the Remmington Tower, the nicer the halls are decorated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cart glides by a series of windows that reveal the rigorous training systems invented to test the drivers. The first is a multi-level, state-of-the-art fitness facility in which the far wall again looks out into Cosmopolis. Beyond the standard health club fare, there is a Martial Arts gymnastics group in a standing pyramid. There is also a range of strange devices ranging from the retro steamer boxes, medicine balls and vibrating belts to the hyper-modern triple axis gyro harness.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: As you know, a T-180 driver's got to be in peak physical condition. Across from the gym is a smaller window where the typical anaerobic test is being conducted on a female driver. She is running on a treadmill with lost of wires hooked up to her while several doctors not their approval at the read- outs.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No expense is spared to make sure that when our driver's suit up they are as perfectly tuned as the machines they are controlling. The next window is a massive centrifuge; a huge mechanical arm whipping around a small capsule that blasts past the window.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The best driver must be able to withstand over 4-Gs of force in a typical race.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On the opposite wall is the vibration chamber. A man is strapped to a chair that is vibrating so hard you expect his eyeballs to rattle out. The next window is an underwater tank where a man is driving in a mock up cockpit, executing peddle maneuvers and gear shifts.

dialogues.speaker: REMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The will to win is nothing without the will to prepare and at Team Remmington we prepare our drivers for any eventuality and every possible condition. The final window is the weather chamber where a driver is again in a mock cockpit, blue-lipped and shivering while snow and wind buffet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open and the craft glides in.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I hope I didn't care you, Speed with how hard we push our team. I just wanted you to see how serious we are committed to winning.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I get that.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Good. But also understand that R.I. Isn't all work and no play. The door opens revealing the Drivers' Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A swanky Playboy-style casino club where, stylishly dressed male and female drivers are catered to by beautiful male and female "hostesses." Sprittle's eyes almost pop out.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: That's Cannonball Taylor! Speed urns and sees the Captain of the Remmington Team.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Stop the cart. Jack! Jack, come here. There's someone I want you to meet. Cannonball saunters over, wearing his two goiter-sized, diamond-encrusted champion rings.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speed Racer allow me to introduce two-time Grand Prix Winner, five time WRL Champion and future Hall of Famer, Jack Cannonball Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Honor to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: CANONBALL
dialogues.text: Caught that Thunderhead replay. Nice piece of work.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Wow, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: CANONBALL
dialogues.text: There was a rumor you might be visiting.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It's pretty impressive.

dialogues.speaker: CANONBALL
dialogues.text: Only thing I cared about was that wall over there. He gestures to a special wall fitted with the trophies and medals won by team Remmington through the years.

dialogues.speaker: CANONBALL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That' what sold me. You want to win in this league, you're talking to the right guy. Remmington beams.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Thanks, Jack. Jack nods and the cart pulls away but not before Jack shoots a backward glance at Speed that feels like a shank in a prison yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open and Remmington leads the family into the penthouse suite leaving the cart behind. Standard jaw- dropping view, decorated in an upscale masculine aesthetic. Sparky whistles and whispers to Speed.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Long way from Nob Hill, eh?

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: We treat our thoroughbreds the way they deserve to be treated. He guides them into the room gesturing or demonstrating all of the amenities.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's full maid service of course with a personal chef and a masseuse available 24/7. The staff arrives, wheeling in several racks of clothes: daywear, sportswear, racing uniforms and stylish evening wear. Gennie holds up one of the suit to Speed.

dialogues.speaker: GENNIE
dialogues.text: Should be perfect. Try it on.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Mmm hmm!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .okay. He heads to the bathroom. Taking Mom by the elbow, Remmington gestures to the sitting area over-looking Cosmopolis.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: So Mrs. Racer, what do you think about my family? Impressed?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: You could say that.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Good. I want you to understand the possibilities that exist for your son right now. Pops furrows his brow.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong Mr. Racer?

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: To be honest, Remmington, I'm feeling more intimidated than impressed. This kind of company scares me. People like you have way too much money and when someone has this kind of money, they start thinking that the rules everyone else is playing by don't mean squat to them. Remmington remains skillfully unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: However, my sons are the most important thing I've ever done in my life, besides marrying my best friend and if Speed wants us to figure out some kind of... "alliance" then you can bet your ass we'll be in business. Speed steps out of the bathroom. His boyishness has faded away as he suddenly seems very much a man. Gennie smile approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Hubba hubba. He walks over to the sitting area.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Oh honey, you looks so handsome.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Very sharp, Speed. Suits you perfectly. Regardless of what happens, I want you to have all of it. A gift.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mr. Remmington.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: So, how are you feeling Speed? Speed isn't sure. He looks at Trixie and Sparky and then at his parents.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It's very... impressive. Remmington smiles.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: You think that maybe there's something that could work out here? Everyone waits, staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I guess I'd like to think about it, if I .could. has really Remmington's a fisherman not sure if the hook been set.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: This isn't the kind of offer I go around making ever day, son.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I understand that, sir... He looks to Pops then takes a deep breath as though trying to find his resolve.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So if I had to give an answer now then, to be honest--

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Stop. Right there. You're right. You should think about it. I'm sure you're feeling a bit overwhelmed. You should take a little time. Think about what you saw and heard here and we'll get together early next week. Deal? He reaches his hand out and Speed takes it with some obvious relief.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHACK! WHACK! WHACK! A thug soundly slaps the face ofa handsome Japanese man. When the beating is over, the Japanese man slumps forward, his arms behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Ithought we had a deal... When he hears the voice, he lifts his head and we see a huge man with a body like a cement-lined safe, sitting behind a desk, lighting a cigar. This well-dressed fixer is Cruncher Block.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought we were friends. He blows a cloud of smoke and watches it float up to the chandelier which is jiggling steadily.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe where you come from, this is how you treat your friends, but 'round here we don't take to kindly to this kind of thing, do we fellas? Thug #1 steps in and wails away on him again.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: You hurt our feelings!

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Problem is, I like you Katsu. Cruncher grins, his teeth like stacked dice.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I got a real soft spot in my heart for that sister of yours. He begins opening a large package wrapped with butcher paper. -Inside is a bloody rack of ribs.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Normally in a situation such as this we would be pouring you a nice comfy pair of cement shoes, but... He stands and goes to the large glowing fish tank that is behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think I got another solution.. He dips the bloody meat into the tank filled with piranha. The water foams as the carnivorous fish shred flesh from bone.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How're my babies doing? Huh? Hungry? Ready for seconds? Boys! They grab Katsu and haul him to the fishtank.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Hope dem fishes like Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: No, please!

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Gonna be hard to drive with skellie hands. Cruncher takes hold of Katsu's jaw.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: You even think about turning rat and next time it's your sister going in there.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: They begin forcing his hand into the tank when suddenly red light begins flashing. Everyone freezes. Cruncher grabs the phone on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We realize that Cruncher's office is in the trailer of a semi-truck which is cruising down an empty rural highway.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Someone's tailing us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruncher signals to the man at the far end of the room who is guarding the door. The guard slides open a peek-a- boo slot and sees a pair of headlights.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: is it him?

dialogues.speaker: DOOR GUARD
dialogues.text: It could be. Cruncher goes to the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Can you see him yet?

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Here he comes-- The car pulls up even with the cab and the driver feels his gut clench as he recognizes the infamous car of Racer X.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Get him! Everyone leaps into action, shoving Katsu back into a chair. Filling their fists with guns, sliding open murder holes slots at a variety of heights. Cruncher barks into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crush him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver screws his jaw tight and throws the wheel to smash into the smaller car--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But the little black tinted bug flits away with effortless ease, dancing out in front of the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruncher flips over the top of his desk revealing the controls for a mini-machine gun located on the bottom of the truck. He grabs the controls which are linked to an infrared sighting camera.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver watches the red tail-lights glowing like demon eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: He's out front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruncher, hits another button and he front grill of the truck opens, dropping the lower half like the double- hinged jaw of a snake. An Apache helicopter-style rocket launcher thrusts out of the darkness. Cruncher sights the car.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Gotcha. He fires a mini-rocket straight at the manta-finned car-- But with a quick feint left the rocket skims by, exploding further down the highway. Something flashes on the back car as hidden tubes iris open and the barrels of several weapons extend out.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Here he comes! Cruncher fires again, the red rocket just missing, rending open the tree line with a fireball.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The little car drops back alongside the truck and fires, bullets bursting tires and puncturing through the walls of the truck. The truck lurches as the thugs fire wildly at the black car. Cruncher tries to site the machine gun but just as he opens fire-- The black car slows, drawing the chasing gun fire until Cruncher shoots his own tires.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Aww, I thought you fixed that! The black car fires again, bullets ricocheting inside, puncturing a hole in the fish tank.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Boss!

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: My babies! He runs to the fish tank and tries to stop the water pouring out of the hole. He sticks his finger in and the fish immediately attack. He shrieks withdrawing his finger.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vinny put your finger in there! Vinny doesn't want to.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck swerves as the driver struggles to control the behemoth wobbling on its blown tires.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: We can't take another hit boss!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruncher thinks fast over Vinny's screams. He looks at Katsu and immediately knows what he has to do.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Pull over but don't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck slows, easing onto the shoulder as the black car follows. The back of the truck slides up and the gangsters toss Katsu out, leaving him behind with a spray of gravel. Katsu looks up into the glaring lights of the black car. A car door opens. Boots crunch gravel as someone walks toward us silhouetted by car lights. It is the masked racer himself--- Racer x.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katsu is in the passenger seat as the car hums quietly down the empty highway.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Thank you. You saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: I didn't save anything worth saving unless you get smart. Real fast. Racer talks without looking at him.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You thought you could take on the Cartel. You can't. Not without help.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: I don't know what'you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: You won the Cortex Invitational and you weren't supposed to. You did it to save Okamoto Engineering.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: It has belonged to my family for five generations.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: And now someone else wants it. The only way you can stop it from happening is to talk to the authorities.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: There is nothing to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: You have been on cruncher Block's leash for.so long maybe you forgot how it feels to stand up and be a man. The only way you'll ever stop these people is to bring them to justice.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Justice/ That's a commodity I don't waste money on. Racer X immediately pulls his car over.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Get out. Wearing his smirk like a cheap suit, Katsu gets out.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: I'll see you at Fuji.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: You won't finish. When you lose, if you can still dial a phone, call this number. He hands him a card. The card reads; CHIEF INSPECTOR DETECTOR.

dialogues.speaker: KID
dialogues.text: Sprittle is working hard on a test when he hears the behind him whisper.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Hey monkey-lover, show me your test or I'll kick your ass after school.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Cheaters never prosper. The kid to the left chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: MALCOM
dialogues.text: Spriiiitle, when Chim-chim's bad, do you spank the monkey?

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: No, your mother does it for me. Malcom almost swallows his tongue as several other kids snicker..

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER
dialogues.text: All right! Malcom! Danny! Sprittle! To the Principal's office. March! There is a chorus of, "I didn't do it, awwww, not fair."

dialogues.speaker: TEACHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now! EXT. ELEMENTARY SCHOOL. The same school that Speed attended but now where Rex used to wait, Speed is leaning against the Mach-5. Chim- chim is sitting next to him. The bell rings and the students begin piling out. When the last few tumble down the stairs, Chim-chim emits a small, sad whine.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Looks like someone's in trouble again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's later and they're driving home. Sprittle stares out the window, mumbling, identifying make, model, and engines of passing cars.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Want to talk about it? Sprittle shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: K-W Integral 4-door with twin-cam turbine...C-foster-K 1200, modified split-rail and supershocks...

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Was it that Stanton kid again? Did he say something? If you want to kick his butt--? He shakes his head again.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: .it doesn't seem fair that I get in trouble, when they always start it.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It's not fair. But that's what bullies do. They make the world unfair.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: That sucks.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Yes, it does.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: What can I do about it?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: You ignore 'em when you can, fight 'em when you can't.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Those choices suck too.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Yeah, but just try to keep one thing in mind.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Bullies come and go but a family can torture you forever. Chim-chim gives Sprittle a wet-willy.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Heeeeeey! Speed laughs as Chim-chim howls and then puts his arm around Sprittle.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: But no joke, you just say the word, little brother and we got your back, right Chim-chim? Chim-chim grunts.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Thanks guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington watches a GRX rolling off the assembly line. With him is Mr. Mushi, a businessman with eyes as sharp as broken glass.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: The new GRX has a super charged inner-positive transporter and will be capable of speeds in excess off 800 kilometers an hour. Mushi nods.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHI
dialogues.text: If such a car were to win the Grand Prix this year, one would expect the demand for transponders to increase dramatically.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: One would expect.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHI
dialogues.text: And if a single company gained control of all the transponder foundries in the world, one might expect that company to do very well for itself.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: You know what I want and I know that for the last few years you have been trying to buy out your main rival Tetsua Okamoto. The question is, can we make a deal? The car rotates, rising up on its mechanical arm, a cybernetic giant, exercising its might.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHI
dialogues.text: Deliver Okamoto at that price and the Taiobi Transponder foundry is yours.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Done. Remington smiles as they shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed and Trixie lie with seats all the way back,

dialogues.speaker: CAR-
dialogues.text: watching the sinking sun tye-dye the sky behind the scape of freeways.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: You're really considering signing with Remmington.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I just said it was tempting.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Well, they got a really good team.. Cannonball Taylor, Markie Manifold. They win a lot of Majors.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Since when did winning become so important?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It is important. You gotta win if you want to keep driving and that's what I want to do. It's the only thing I really know how to do. When I'm driving, I feel like that's the only time my life makes sense. She moves closer to him.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: You mean, this doesn't make sense to you?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Okay, besides being with you.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: So you like being with me?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: You know I do.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Sometimes I do, sometimes I'm not so sure.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Sometimes around your family, you seem distant, not like this and I wonder why.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Come on, you know how I've felt about you since I was ten years old.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I guess so, I just wish you weren't so shy about it.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What do you want me to do? Kiss you in front of everyone at the end of a big race?

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Would that be so terrible?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe we should practice first.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Maybe we should. They start to kiss when they hear a muted voice.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Oh God! I'm gonna hurl! Huuuurrrl!

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Sprittle?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Speed jumps out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He did not! He throws open the trunk, revealing Sprittle and Chim-chi who shrieks.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sprittle!

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: It wasn't my idea!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Oh no?

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: It was his! He points at Chim-chim who shakes his head wildly, pointi back at Sprittle.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Wait till we tell Pops.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: No! Don't do that! We're sorry. We couldn't sleep. We just wanted to hang out. We didn't know you were going to In-spew-ration Point. By the way, Cootie-shots. Sprittle and Chim-chim immediately cover one shoulder giving themselves a cootie-shot.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm taking you home.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait-- Speed slamsthe trunk shut so we hear Sprittle voice

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can we stop for ice cream first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on a curving piece of bodywork that Pops is sanding. When he looks up, Speed is in the room.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is carrying a brown paper sack.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Morning, Speed.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Pops.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: So, today's the big day. Speed nods. Pops puts down his tools.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know this is a tremendous opportunity for you.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It could be for you too.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Could be, could be. But, regardless, this is really all about you. It' your decision and I want you to know, no matter what you decide, I'm behind you.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Thanks, Pops. The room begins to shake.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: I think your ride's here.

dialogues.speaker: LIKE
dialogues.text: Speed stares out the window, chewing on his decision a dog worrying a bone.

dialogues.speaker: IS
dialogues.text: Gennie greets Speed as he debarks from the plane. He carrying his brown sack.

dialogues.speaker: GENNIE
dialogues.text: Speed, so nice to see you again. Her,eyes and the softness of her touch elevate flirting to something that is equal parts art and science.

dialogues.speaker: GENNIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr. Remmington is so excited about this meeting. He hasn't talked about anything else all week. Speed sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cabin is dark and still. Slowly, almost supernaturall a drawer begins to slide open. Two heads pop up. Sprittle and Chim-chim are wearing cat- burglar clothes with matching ski-masks. The coast is clear, so they sneak over to the galley. They stare at the drawer like a safe-cracker eyeing the dial of a combination lock. Sprittle carefully pulls back the latch springing the dra It slides open, lit internally, candy gleaming like jewel The breath rushes out of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The office sits atop the strata-scraper, surrounded by commanding views of Cosmopolis. Speed arrives via the elevator and Remmington breaks into a beaming. smile.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Speed! Gennie leaves speed, returning to the elevator, as Remmington crosses to him. He hugs him

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Welcome back! Come. Sit. Sit.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In the center of the room is a small cluster of extremely comfortable chairs in which they sit. Above them a multifaceted skylight glitters like a cut gem under the streaming rays of sunlight. In the center of the sky light is the R.I. Logo casting a great shadow on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I get you something to drink? Water? Bubbly? A shot of rye? Speed smiles sheepishly.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: No... I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: So, I can see you have given some serious thought to this thing.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I have, yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Good. That means that you understand that we are talking about not just your future, but your family's future.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .my family means a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I know. I can tell. That's why this is so important. Because you can help them. All you have to say is yes. That is all I need to hear and I can make so many things happen for you, and your family. Are you ready for that? Are you ready to say yes, Speed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candy wrappers are scattered everywhere as they lay motionless in an overdose coma. When they hear someone coming Sprittle manages to lift his head and crawl to the window.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A cleaning man is rising up on a cherry picker with a cart full of cleaning supplies.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. He looks back at their mess.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: jig's up. A moment later the door opens and the cleaning man enters

dialogues.speaker: CLEANING MAN
dialogues.text: Holy cooly: He grabs for his radio.

dialogues.speaker: CLEANING MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, this is Marvin down at the landing pad. I think we got mice again. As he talks, two shadows slip quietly out the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed realizes that this is the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: This isn't an easy decision for me, Mr. Remmington. For my family, racing is everything. We eat, drink, think and breathe racing. There is nothing more perfect than a picnic at Thunderhead. I mean, I was taught to drive before I could walk. But when my brother died, all that went away. I can't tell you how painful that was. It nearly killed all of us. Especially Pops. He didn't set foot in his shop for over a year. As the memory comes to life, we see the images in flashba

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But one night when I was still pretty young. I couldn't sleep and I went into the living room and there was Pops, in his beat up robe, watching some old race recordings. The blue tv light of Speed's memory fills his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I sat with him watching of Ben Burns coming round the last turn of he '43 Prix and all of a sudden Pops started screaming, and then I started screaming, and as Burns and Dugazi duked it out, heading for the finish, we were cheering our heads off and the second the black and white came down, we looked at each other and right there we realized the naked truth; racing is in our blood. Flashback ends.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But for Pops, it isn't just a sport. It's way more important than that. It's like a religion and in our house, the Major Sponsors are kinda like the devil. The coldness in Remmington's eyes belies his smile.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't mean to offend you sir and I do appreciate your offer, it's just, I guess I understand his -point of view and after all we've been through, I don't think this kind of deal is for me. Remmington chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: You poor, naive, chump. He chuckles again.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that load of sickening schmaltz and I am going to give you a bit of an education. At the end of it if you're smart, you'll thank me and hen you'll sign that contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprittle and Chim-chim are joy riding in the maintenance cart, weaving back an forth, wiping people out. Chim-chim screams with glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand before an enlarged black and white photograph of five tycoons, smoking cigars, dressed in turn of the century tycoon finery, their well-fed faces bright with fatuous, self-satisfied smiles.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Look. There is the true spirit of the golden age of racing. Benjamin Braddack, Diamond Dave Tweksbury, Reginald White, Oliver Potter, and George Wheeler. The five most powerful men in the world at the turn of the last century. As he talks we flash back to jittery old footage and photographs of the golden era.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
