dialogues.text: For all intensive purposes they created the modern automotive industry. But the true stroke of their genius was the invention of the WRL, the world's first racing league. Remmington leads Speed past several personal mementos including the first motor of his first car, the first milk bottle from victory lane,.a black and white from an important race. In front of an enlarged picture of Ben Burns from the infamous '43 Prix is a twisted and scorched piece of metal set on a pedestal like a gorgeous piece of art.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Interesting that you and your father were so moved by the '43 Prix. One of the great finishes in the history of racing, right? Everyone remembers Burns and Dugazi slugging it out, but who remembers Carl Potts? Driving a rebuilt Wittigan for Iodyne . Industries, Potts spun out in the second lap and went down as a DNF. A forgettable and pathetic finish. So bad, that afterwards Iodyne stock dropped six points. Again we see the history told in flashback.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, Ben Burns sat guzzling cold fresh milk in victory lane, a thousand cameras taking his picture, Sirrus Aeronautics saw almost a twelve point gain which immediately block Penninsula Power Cell from being able to afford the price of a complete take-over. This put Joel Goldman, the CEO of Iodyne Inc. in the exact position he wanted to be in. By first buying controlling interest in his own company at a devalued price, he then brokered a merger with Sirrus that immediately sent Iodyne into the gains record book-- the only record book that matters. Look out that window, there isn't a single plane or helicopter or K- Harrier that isn't powered by Iodyne fuel cells. That's what racing is about. It has nothing to do with cars, or drivers. All that matters is power and the unassailable might of money. His greed is as tangible as any drug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security guard glides out of one of the red secured area doors on a segway.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: His radio buzzes "perps last seen tramway four, driving a maintenance cart." The doors start to close when Sprittle and Chim-chim jump out and sneak inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed doesn't want to hear any more of this, but, Remmington is far from done.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Do you understand? Burns knew he was going to win. It was already decided. A week before the Prix, Goldman and Sirrus met with several other major players at the Carlyle Hotel. They met there as they had for years, just as their fathers had met, and as their sons and heirs will still meet. They met to negotiate the finish order of the Grand Prix. No race is more important and no race is more controlled. That year Goldman was supposed to win, but he knew if he sold his win to Sirrus, whatever that win might be worth, was nothing compared to what could be gained. He turns back to the twisted piece of crash metal.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's why I paid three million dollars for this burnt and twisted piece of metal. Because it reminds me of what really matters. This is the true heart of racing boy! This is my religion! Speed is aghast.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don't know how many times I have seen that same cow-eyed "say it isn't so" look of disbelief. Every bumpkin who comes in from the sticks looks exactly like you do now. I won't bother proving it to you.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you walk away from me, if you walk out of.this deal, you'll know how true it is soon enough. So, last chance. What's it going to be, Speed? Your father's little fantasy bubble? Or are you going to join the rest of us adults, here in reality?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several technician carts and trollies carrying auto parts pass by a single lab technician who staggers, drunkenly up to a red restricted area window. Sprittle peaks out of the lower half of the lab coat, Chim-chim wearing the helmet, balances on his shoulder. In the window they see a lab where they are testing a "spear---hook;" a secret attacking device that shoots out from one car and grabs hold of the undercarriage of another car. As they realize what they are looking at, a security goon comes gliding up behind them on his seg-way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed hands him the brown paper bag.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: What's this? He looks and sees the shoes and suit.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: If that's your idea of racing, you can keep it.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Listen to me and listen good kid, because I'm going to give you one more history lesson. You're going to go to Fuji-- In quick, collage cuts we see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous blimp shot of the race track which takes up an entire island of Hawaii-like archipelago. The track weaves in and out of the lush tropical landscape set against the ocean shimmering with sequins of sunlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed grips the steering wheel, revving the engine which rattles the car like thunder shaking the sky as-- The countdown finishes and as the cars explode forward, we cut back--

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: But you won't win. You won't place. More collage cuts--

dialogues.speaker: FUJI ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Speed Racer's making his move, gunning for the lead--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ghost sees Speed rushing up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: We got ourselves a real race here! The two cars start dancing around each other; like two boxers sizing each other up.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here we go, here we go. Wham. Ghost throws the first punch which Speed tries to slip but, the Ghost anticipates his move and slams Speed hard.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Show me something! Show me what you got! Speed ducks down the bank, working each wheel into a hyper drift, reversing their position-- Locking the Ghost up and sending both cars spinning.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ohhhh yeah! Yeeeeeahhhhh!

dialogues.speaker: FUJI ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The Gray Ghost unloads a round- house, Speed counters, smashing, banging, bumping-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weaving back and fourth behind Speed, the Gray Ghost attacks with phantom punches that come out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: Here I come, kid! Watch out. Here I am! Nope--I'm over here! Wham! Wham! Speed tries to counter punch and the Ghost slips under.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can't.touch me! I'm here! I'm gone! Speed is thrown back into the pack of cars that quickly swallow him up where he is-- Crunched into the wall by the Zokeo Communications car, pinned until-- Racer X slams into the Zokeo car, freeing Speed but causing several cars tp swerve wildly at which point-- The Three Roses car torpedoes Katsu's car-- Bursting into a blizzard of metal snowflakes while--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horuko jumps up, terrified for her brother as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racer X roars past the debris and the bouncing rubber cocoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruncher accepts the congratulations of the goon beside him.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON DRIVER
dialogues.text: I guarantee you right now, you won't even finish the race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another molar-cracking hit as Speed avoids the concrete, pylon but is then slammed by the Zokeo car-- Underneath both cars, a spear-hook shoots out from a hidden sleeve, harpooning the under-carriage of the Mach

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Speed, get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I can't! I can't move! The two cars head toward the final jump, locked in some strange embrace-- They lunge awkwardly, crashing on top of one another as-- Inside Speed's car, his face plate seals and the kwiksave foam explodes, swallowing him, as the car tumbles-- Disintegrating into a cloud of smoke and glittering debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Racer family is frozen. Their faces awash with fear and disappointment while--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington eases back, a fatuous, self-satisfied smile spreading with a crocodile's grace.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Soon after that there will be litigation against some of your father's designs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is pouring rain as a large cab pulls up to drop off the entire Racer family still wearing their island clothes. A dour-faced man beneath an umbrella is waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: DOUR FACE
dialogues.text: Are you Pops Racer of Racer Motors-

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm still on vacation-

dialogues.speaker: DOUR FACE
dialogues.text: You are hereby served a summons.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DOUR FACE
dialogues.text: You are being sued for IP infringement by Janus Automakers.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: That's ridiculous!

dialogues.speaker: DOUR FACE
dialogues.text: That's for a jury to decide.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: The legitimacy of the lawsuits won't matter. They will be enough to discredit his company. Whatever contracts he has, he'll lose. Within a year he will be filing for bankruptcy. After that, you and the rest of your pathetic family will be history. The threat hangs in the air like a loaded gun between them.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Pops was right. You are the devil. The elevator suddenly opens with the security goon carrying Sprittle and Chim-chim by the scruff of their necks.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Sprittle?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GOON
dialogues.text: Mr. Remmington I caught these two snooping in a restricted area.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON DRIVER
dialogues.text: Get this Racer trash out of my building.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'll see you at Fuji. Speed turns and heads for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON DRIVER
dialogues.text: Yes and then you'll realize that you just made the biggest mistake of your life!

dialogues.speaker: TNT. RACER KITCHEN -MORNING
dialogues.text: Close up on The Racing News that Sparky is reading from. The main headline: ANOTHER DIRTY RACER?

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: ". .controversy surrounds Racer Motors now embroiled in IP litigation and while evidence remains inconclusive whether or not Speed used an illegal device, the Fuji Helexicon seems destined to become another mark of shame added to the notorious Racer family legacy, a legacy that has forever tainted the integrity of this beloved sport."

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Sparky. That's enough.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Sorry ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: I'm going to send that guy some Chim-chim cookies. Chim-chim guffaws.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: You'll do no such thing.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: We gotta do something, Pops. Speed steps into the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: This is exactly what he said would happen if I didn't drive for him.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: You mean Remmington?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: He said it'd get worse and worse and by the end of the year you'd be filing for bankruptcy, Pops.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Okay, he's definitely gettin' some monkey cookies.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Sprittle!

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: He was just trying to scare you, son. They tried the same thing with Rex. If it's a fight they want, it's a fight they'll get.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: How? What can we do? How can we fight this? He tosses the newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: The truth will come out.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: The truth? Don't be naive, Pops. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Ben Burns poster is ripped from the wall. Speed wads its up and throws it into the garbage. He sinks down to his bed, a sense of powerlessness crushing the life out of him. Mom taps and then cracks the door.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Speed? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .I don't know. She comes in and sits beside him, putting her arm around him.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: It'll be okay. We'll get through it.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I don't know, mom. I might have really messed things up.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: By not joining Remmington.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Don't be silly. You'd have never been happy driving for that terrible man.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: But maybe racing isn't about being happy. Maybe Remmington's right and it's all about business and anyone who doesn't understand that is just a chump.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Now you listen to me, young man. What you do behind the wheel of a racecar has nothing to do with business. Before you could even talk, you were making noises that sounded like a car engine. We used to tell people you were speaking car-ese. We used to try to take you to the park but you never wanted to get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .I loved that old wagon.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: And do you remember the time Rex took you out to Thunderhead and let you drive-- Speed smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: And I turned it over.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: My heart still pounds just thinking about it.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Rex told me the only reason we survived was because I was wearing red socks.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I thought your father was going to have a stroke when you walked in the door with that crazy smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten year old Speed comes in the door, leading Rex, wearing a small bandage on his forehead, smiling, a big black gap where his two front teeth should be.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I don't think I ever saw you as happy as you were telling anybody who asked, how you lost your two front teeth in your first crash.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Speed, when I watch you do some of the things you do, I feel like I'm watching someone paint or play music. When I go to the races, I go to watch you make art and it's beautiful and inspiring and everything that art should be, even though there are times when I have to close my eyes. But then there are other times, when you just take my breath away and it's at those moments, when I feel your father's chest swell and I know he's smiling, trying to pretend he doesn't have tears in his eyes, I just go to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Because I am so impossibly proud to be your mother. And even though your father doesn't say it, he is too. She puts her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: MOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't worry. We'll figure this out. We just have to stick together. Something good will happen. You'll see. Ding dong. The front doorbell chimes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprittle opens the door revealing Inspector Detector of the Corporate Investigation Bureau who looks older and harder than when we saw him in the flashbacks Behind him is Racer X. Sprittle sees the masked racer and screams. Chim-Chim screams. They look at each other screaming and then slam the door. They begin running around, flailing like Chicken Little, waving their arms in panic.

dialogues.speaker: RUN FOR YOUR LIVES
dialogues.text: Popsstorms into the room.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What are you two squawking about? They dive behind the couch but peek out as Pops heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Pops, whatever you do, don't open the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racer X doesn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: This is a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: If it was any other driver, you'd be here. Popsopens the door and Racer X sets his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Inspector Detector?

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: Good morning, Mr.. Racer. I know it's been a long time--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He extends his hand and Pop shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Ten years.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm sorry for this intrusion, but I was hoping to have a word with you and Speed. Pops eyes the masked racer.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom serves coffee and cookies.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: We've been after Remmington for years for dozens of capital corporate crimes including WRL fixing but we haven't had the evidence we need to convict him. Until now. Sprittle and Chim-chim peek up from behind the couch as Mom offers the masked racer a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Here you are, Mr. X. Sprittle points at Racer X.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: What's he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: Racer X works closely with our WRL corporate crimes division, helping us recruit drivers like you, Speed. Most of the media, which you are now seeing is controlled by the Major Sponsors and they have done their best to paint him as a menace to the sport. The truth is he's our most valuable weapon against these villains.

dialogues.speaker: SPEEED
dialogues.text: Why does he always wear that mask?

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: If any of, you actually knew his identity, you would become targets for his enemies which include some of the most vicious Fixers in the world. Gulp. They both sink back down behind the couch.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What do you want with me?

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: You're familiar with the driver Katsu Okamoto?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: For years he has been contracted by a Fixer named Cruncher Block who we know works for Remmington. Recently, Katsu has been forced to lose races that have led to a droop in the stock price of Okamoto Engineering. We believe this is a part of a corporate strategy to allow Mushi motors to buy control of Okamoto. Katsu doesn't want this to happen and he began resisting, thinking.that he could do it on his own. After Fuji, he realized he needed help.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: ,Why help him?

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: Because he has a file with enough information to connect Block to Remmington which could put both of them behind bars for the rest of their lives. The problem is, he won't give us the file unless we help him stop the take over of his family's company.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: There is an up-coming race that Katsu believes if he can win, it will catapult Okamoto Engineering back into the spotlight and double the cost of the buy out which should kill it.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: But there aren't any more races left except for the Grand Prix and we both failed to qualify. Inspector takes a big breath.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: There aren't any track races. This is a cross-country rally.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: You mean The Crucible?

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: I know it seems cruel of me to ask, but Katsu made it clear that he had to have Speed an X on his team or there would be no deal.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Absolutely out of the question.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: You'll have the support of the entire C.I.B--

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: No! Rally racing is a back alley sport full of jackals, head- hunters and thugs! I'm sorry, Inspector but I lost one son to that death-trap. I won't lose another.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: I understand. If you change your

dialogues.speaker: MIND--
dialogues.text: He starts to take out his card.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Keep your card, Chief Inspector.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Speed looks at Pops, then realizes that Racer X is staring straight at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is raining, the cockpit bubble smeared with the distant traffic lights.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: And the way he was looking at me, I don't know...I just gotta do something.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: But Pops will never let you go.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: He won't if I ask him.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Speed Racer what are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: You weren't in Remmington's office, Trix. You don't know what it was like. It felt as though he had his hand inside my chest and he was trying to crush everything in my life that mattered to me.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I hate him. I'm picturing his heart clogging with cholesterol right now.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: No joke, Trix. If you could have been in that room, you'd want to do anything you could to take this guy down. She looks straight into his eyes and he doesn't have to say anything else.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: All right. Let's do it. You're going to need an alibi. We'll say we're going skiing.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What? No way!

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: You're going to need my help. Casa Cristo is a rally. I can spot from a 'copter.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Trixie, this isn't a game. These people play rough.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I know. That's why I'm coming with you. And if you even try to argue with me, I'll tell Pops right now and he won't let you out of his sight.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: You would, wouldn't you? He looks into her eyes and knows the answer.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well...I guess we're going skiing. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington sits surrounded by the legal equivalent of knights, bishops and rooks while Mr. Mushi sits across from him supported by his own retinue. Behind them, Cannonball Taylor blasts through the test course fast enough to coax a low rumble from the sound barrier.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: As I'm sure you're aware, the Okamoto stock fell another four points yesterday. In the next few days it will hit bottom and they will have to sell. The car roars through its elliptical path like a circling electron binding the two tycoons together.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHI
dialogues.text: This could be a most profitable year for Remmington. Remmington can't hide the glow.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Mushi won't do too badly either. Mushi nods. Cannonball circles, everything in apparent harmony until Gennie leans in and whispers. GENNIE. I know this is terrible timing sir, but I've just received confirmation of several last minute entries to the Casa Cristo 5000.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: GENNIE
dialogues.text: You're not going to like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two announcers beam into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: We're just minutes away from the start of the 82nd annual Casa Cristo Classic, the grand dame of cross-country, the second oldest rally race in the world, spanning two continents, three climate changes and five thousand kilometers of the most winding and treacherous roads ever raced. Heturns to his colleague.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: With me again is five time Casa Cristo champion, Johnny "Goodboy" Jones.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Always great to be here. Such a beautiful city.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: One of the most romantic cities in the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bell man carefully unloads a cart. On top of the stack of suitcases is a gold fish bowl with a single ugly piranha. Cruncher stands at the window balcony looking out over the white-washed city.

dialogues.speaker: BELLMAN
dialogues.text: Is there anything else I can do for you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Yeah ...I wanna send someone a present.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Safety has been the primary concern for Casa Cristo officials, especially the last few years.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: That's right Bob. There were a number of fatalities several years ago. It really had a bad reputation for a while.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Fans started calling it "The Crucible."

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Most of the T-180 drivers wouldn't come near it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: But you look today, we've got some major names like Millie "the mouse" Manno, Snake Oiler and Katsu Okamoto as well as the young rising star Speed Racer. Not to mention, the shadow that seems to hang over every major race these days, the masked racer that some fans call the Harbinger of Boom. What's your take on Racer X?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Obviously he is an extremely talented and disciplined driver.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: But is he a head hunter?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I think he drives like he'is not always interested in winning.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Nuff' said.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: But remember Colton, these are standard road cars, not T-180s. I know a lot of T-180 drivers who I raced against who expected to win but found out racing a few laps on a track is a totally different animal than a cross-country rally.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The marathon as opposed to the sprint?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Exactly. This isn't just about going fast. It's about endurance. More than anything, winning Casa Cristo is a test of will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed grips his steering wheel like it was the handle of a weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inspector extends his hand which Speed grips tightly.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: Speed, I want you to understand how much the C.I.B. appreciates your help on this.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm not doing this to help C.I.B. I don't know anything about corporate crimes and honestly, if I did, it wouldn't really matter. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm doing this because someone is trying to hurt my family and I'm going to do everything I can to hurt him back. The masked racer is unable to mask his smile.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The reason.T-180 drivers have always come to Casa Cristo is because the winner is automatically offered an invitation to the Grand Prix next week. A hold over from the days when rally racing was far more popular then track racing. JOHNNY. Gosh how things have changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leather of his gloves creak as he wrings his steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: 'INT. HOTEL SUITE
dialogues.text: The doorbell rings and Katsu goes to it. A hotel bellman surrounded by Katsu's bodyguards is smiling.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: He says it's for Horuko, from an admirer. Katsu looks at the ribboned box as the guard runs his metal detector over it.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: You see how we have to live? He ignores her, turning away as she starts to open it. She screams. Inside the goldfish bowl the piranha shreds a piece of meat that could be a finger, staining-the water red.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: To compete in this race, you really have to have a killer instinct. Any sign of weakness or timidness is like blood in the water and you'll see how fast this race turns into a feeding frenzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racer X calmly checks his car's vitals as he revs his engine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racer X leads Speed and Inspector Detector through the lab to where Minx is working.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: We're going to need some insurance for this race. Minx clicks away at a keyboard while a digital Mach 5 rotates on a screen.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Minx builds my cars.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Nice to meet ya. She purrs in response. Racer X nods and she uses the computer to illustrate her modifications.

dialogues.speaker: MINX
dialogues.text: Their cars will probably be equipped with secret weapons so we have modified your car to try to counter their attacks. The "A" button will operate your normal jump-jacks. The Mach 5 flips over on the screen highlighting the newly installed jump-jacks.

dialogues.speaker: MINX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "B" will seal your cockpit, which we've fortified with a bulletproof polymer. Gun-bots fire digital bullets at the Mach 5 which ricochet off the blueprint glass.

dialogues.speaker: MINX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "C" will inflate an emergency hexadyno spare after any blowout. Avatar vandals slash the Mach 5's tires, which explode then re-inflate.

dialogues.speaker: MINX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "D" will activate these zircon tipped saw blades that will cut through anything that tries to attach itself to you. The Mach 5 opens like a Swiss army knife.

dialogues.speaker: MINX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "E" will project the tire crampons. The image zooms in on the newly equipped cat-claw tires.

dialogues.speaker: MINX, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And "F" will launch a remote control homing bird that is capable of transmitting QTVR footage anywhere you are. A final click demonstrates the capabilities of the Mach 5's homing bird.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Every race fan has heard the rumors of spearhooks, tire shanks and battery boosters.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: The league has done a tremendous job to clean rally racing up. While it's true there have been a few bad apples, on the'whole most teams stay within league rules. He winks into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Or at least try not to get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We glide through the lines of race cars with x-ray vision cam, revealing hidden weapons; spring loaded Ben-Hur tire shredders, all manner of grabbers and grapplers as well as bladders filled with oil or grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprittle and Chim-chim are settling in on the couch; a big bag of potato chips and ice filled glasses of coke. The Casa Cristo is about to begin.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Sprittle! Faster than a blink Sprittle grabs the remote and changes the channel to "Unser Charly," a German sitcom starring a monkey.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Just watching a little TV, Pops. Pops looks at the TV suspiciously, then back at his son.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's his favorite show.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: It's in German!

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Not the monkey parts. chim-chim smiles.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Oh no you don't. You are not watching that race. Out you go. Outside. Get some exercise. You're too pale.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The moment the Queen of Casa Cristo sees the sun, she'll signal the start of the race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The horizon glows brighter, whispy clouds slowly soaking up the blood-orange light.

dialogues.speaker: TNT. HOTEL SUITE
dialogues.text: They speak in Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: This is wrong.what you are trying to do.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: I have no choice. Their price is an insult to four generations of our family.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: And if you die? Will then the price be high enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen sees the sun about to break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed revs his engine, a bomb ready to blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large memorial commemorates all the drivers who died during this race: "In memory of those who gave everything for their love of this sport." Trixie stands beside Speed, both of them staring at the name carved into the bronze plaque; Rex Racer.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I understand it now, Trix. I know why he left us. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was trying to change this rotten business and they killed him for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Queen raises a starter's pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snake Oiler and his two HydroCell team-mates meet with Cruncher and his gang, including Vinny "Three-Fingers," his hand still bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE
dialogues.text: This is supposed to be my race! I'm supposed to win! I got the green light! They. promised I'd get to go to the Grand Prix! For eight years I've played by the rules! This is supposed to be my race!

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Enough! I can't stand the whining!

dialogues.speaker: VINNY
dialogues.text: Like a baby needing its diaper changed. Snake works his jaw looking for the right comeback.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: It's simple. We have a team of wild cards. The problem is these wild cards are better drivers than you.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE
dialogues.text: Like hell they are!

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Prove it. Take out Katsu. The other two will quit.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Snake seethes.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE
dialogues.text: You just watch me. Come on! He and his boys storm out, slamming the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun cracks the horizon and the Queen fires the gun. All at once tires explode into a wail of rubber burning agony, smoke billowing from the sound of their screams. The cars shoot down through the corridor of the small streets like shotgun pellets through a barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars roar through the streets to the cheers of the locals, while above, team helicopters circle with the industriousness of bees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trixie speaks into her headset.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Katsu, HydroCell's coming up on your left. The HydroCell cars jostle their way towards Katsu, Speed and Racer X.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: I got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racer X and Speed are escorted by Okamoto security into the room. Speed notices Horuko standing on the balcony and is struck by her beauty. Katsu bows.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: It is such an extraordinary honor to have such talent on my team.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Let's skip the niceties and cut to the chase. Katsuarches an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The only reason we're here is because you needed two outsiders and because the Chief Inspector believes you'll turn over your. file on Remmington and Block. Racer X eyes him.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. I don't trust anyone who needs this kind of deal before they'll bring a criminal to justice. The accusation hangs in the air.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I'm willing to take a chance that you'll prove me wrong.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: You won't regret your decision.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: We'll see. Until then you have my word that I will do everything.I can to make sure you checker at Bartimaeus. Katsu smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KNOCKING
dialogues.text: Racer X smashes into one of the HydroCell team, him into a series of billboards. Katsu again smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Arrigato, X. Arrigato.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand around a GPS map of the race.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: If they're so desperate, why not just use some kind of sniper? There's a million places someone could hide if they were really trying to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Any obvious crime would allow the Chief Inspector to shut the race down. That kind of scrutiny would only hurt the business. They'll do as much as they can to make it appear legit. Speed nods.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The real problem we'll have is after the: first leg. Corteges is going to be extremely dangerous. Take my advice, keep your family away from Cortega. Speed again looks out at Moruko on the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katsu roars out of the city onto the desert road.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: They're out of the city and heading into the Zunubian Desert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain of cars weave along the ribbon of concrete while the desert dunes raise up around them. A red bearded driver named Billy Steel-belted, his team covered in the Manecks' logo, begins sliding up next to Speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cobra peeks his head out of a basket, charmed by a gorgeous woman playing her flute. In the audience, Cruncher moves up behind Billy. He hands him a small black velvet bag. Billy pours out a fistful of star-dust; the glint of diamonds glitter in the greed of his smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy smiles revealing his diamond studded teeth then swerves at Speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trixie sees the attack coming.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Speed, jump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed does, just as Billy's car plows through, passing under him.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: He's not alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Manecks team attacks, their cars flying at Katsu even as a second team, the Atomic Injectables led by Tyrus Tropp also attacks.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: This surprises me.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Tyrus is a good man. I wouldn't expect him to turn head-hunter. They aren't pulling any punches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruncher sits, shadows drawn around him like the folded wings of a bat, across from a stoic looking Tyrus. Cruncher slides an envelope across the table. Tyrus looks at the goons surrounding him, then picks it up. Inside are the photographs of a beautiful girl playing in a park. The hard edge in Tyrus' expression immediately softens turning to fear. Cruncher smiles like a snake that has just found an egg.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Things have started heating up, as the cars head out across the desert flats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The swerving, weaving chain of cars churns up a massive cloud of dust in their wake. Attacking cars are caught and spun out by Racer X and Speed. A hurricane of sand and dirt swirl around Katsu who sits calmly in the eye of the storm while- His guardian angels go into overdrive. Racer X and Speed seem like they have been driving together all their lives.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Lead him--

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Here ya go! Speed leads an attack straight into Racer X's counter.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Wing left.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Flying in!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He jumps one car and blocks the attack on X. As their cars merge in.and out from one another, something seems perfectly clear to Speed-- He is back at Thunderhead with the ghost of his brother, dancing around each other until--

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Speed! Wham! Billy slams up against him-- Throwing a lever, a grappler locks on to the Mach 5.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: He's got me! I'm locked up! Another lever is pumped like a tire pump and a sheaved blade begins stabbing at Speed's tires. Racer X watches unable to leave Katsu unprotected. Speed hits the D button and the zircon saw blades start gliding through the grappler.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Get out of there! -

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm trying! The knife slashes the tire which explodes just as the grappler is cut-- Speed flips away free, hitting the "C" button causing a new tire to inflate while he's upside down-- Landing on a new tire, without missing a beat. Tyrus rushes into the opening, but this time it's Katsue who works a hidden lever and-- A Katana-like blade flashes, a samurai slash across the front tire-- Bowing it out, flipping the entire car, which tumbles back straight at Speed, forcing him to try a split-jack

dialogues.speaker: JUMP--
dialogues.text: Firing only the rear jump-jacks, launching the back end of the car while--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The front end of the Mach 5 clips against the Atomic Injectibles car-- Sending Speed flipping end over end but landing with strangely beautiful grace.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Did I just see that!?

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: A rear single set jump into a forward flip!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: I know he blew up at Fugi, but this kid is flat out magic!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprittle and Chim-chim are laying in lounge chairs wearing bathing suits and tanning goggles, holding tanning mirrors under their chins. Pops walks up.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: I've got to go into town for some parts. I'll be back for lunch.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Sure thing Pops. Pops looks at them, shakes his head and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: HIM
dialogues.text: Sprittle slowly lowers his tanning goggles to watch go.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's go! They drop their mirrors and bolt for the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back with chips and cokes clicking on the tv as the cars storm across the desert. They start crunching away, oblivious to the sound of the front door opening.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Honey, I can't find my wallet---- Pops enters the room expecting to find Mom but catches them red-handed.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sprittle! He sees the race on tv.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You two are in--

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Wait! Pops, before you get mad at us--Look! Sprittle points at the tv eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: I'm not falling for that--

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: It's Speed!

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Speed's skiing.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Then who's driving the Mach 5? Pops turns and indeed, there's the Mach 5 barrelling across the red baked earth of Zunubia.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: We're nearing the end of the first leg of the Casa Cristo as Snake Oiler, lead driver for the HydroCell team, roars through the streets of Cortega, heading for the finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HydroCell team rear through the cobblestone streets of the medieval city crossing the finish line to a cheering crowd.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The HydroCell team jumped on the lead early and would not give it up.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: They made excellent time. Okamoto is still a couple of minutes behind them.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: They have their work cut out for them tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medieval estate renovated into a hotel. Katsu smashes a buffet laid out for the Okamoto team.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: If we drive tomorrow like we drove today we will lose! He points at the masked racer.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You will get nothing! All of this will be meaningless!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Relax. Snake's weak on turns. We'll catch him in the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: We might if you stop showing off.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Hey, all I was doing was saving your ass. Katsu raises a fist, but Racer X catches it.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Don't fall apart yet. There's still a lot of race to run. Katsu jerks free of Racer X and storms towards the door immediately enveloped by his security team. Speed looks at Racer X as though he can suddenly see through the mask.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A C.I.B. Man will be posted outside your door. We got their attention today. You and Trixie should be very careful tonight. Speed nods as Racer X heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Racer X-- He stops.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought we made a good team today. It felt like we'd been doing it for a long time. He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: If you say so. He turns away leaving Speed alone.

dialogues.speaker: CHICKEN'S
dialogues.text: Remmington wrings the phone as if it were a neck.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Ineptitude? Is this what I pay you for?

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: They ain't checkered yet.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: If. they do, I assure you it will be a very costly mistake for everyone. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: Mr. Remmington, you have Mr. Mushi on line two. Remmington was dreading this call. He hits the button.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Mr. Mushi--

dialogues.speaker: MUSHI
dialogues.text: So, is this what guarantee means to you, Mr. Remmington? Perhaps your dictionary has a different definition.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I understand there is a problem, but I assure you there is no need to panic.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHI
dialogues.text: I am not calling to panic. I am calling to inform you that we will be addressing the problem ourselves, as your assurances and guarantees leaves much to be desired. He hangs up leaving Remmington to stew in his juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed and Trixie are eating a room service dinner.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It was very weird, Trix. I knew every move he was going to make and he knew mine. It was so familiar. Maybe I'm crazy but Racer X first showed up two years after Rex's death.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: But Speed, Rex was cremated.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: A body was cremated. Remember it had already been badly burned in the crash. Even if it was Rex, no one could have recognized him.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: So you think he faked the crash with a different body in the driver's seat?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Somehow the kwik-save was disconnected. Inspector Detector suspected foul play but nothing could be proved.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: okay, let's say it's all true. Why would we do it?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe the same reason I'm here. Ding dong. Speed goes to the door.

dialogues.speaker: C.I.B. SECURITY MAN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to disturb you sir, but do you know these people? Speedsticks his head out and there they are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His family, Pops in front like a kettle ready to boil.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops rages while Sprittle and Chim-chim pick through their dinner.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Is this the kind of driver I have? Someone who disobeys? Someone who lies to me? Is this the kind of son I have raised? And you, Trixie, you know what this race did to this family. Did either of you stop to think about us? Huh? Speed, did you think about your mother? Or your brother? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What it would do if something happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: That's all I've been thinking about, Pops. You, Mom, Sprittle, Sparky. Chim-chim shouts.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, you too, Chim-chim. We are in serious trouble,,Pops, and it's all my fault.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: This is not the place or the race to do anything about that.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Because it won't do any good?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: You think you can drive a car and change the world?! It doesn't work like that!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Maybe not. But it's the only thing I know how to do and I gotta do something.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: That's unacceptable! This is over. Pack your things. We're going home. Speed has never directly disobeyed his father.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I can't. I'm sorry, Pops.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm staying.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: So am

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: No you're not! You're coming home, right now!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm not a child, Pops. You can't tell me how to live my life. If you want to fire me as your driver, then fine, do it. But it won't change the fact that I am going to.finish this race. Pops looks ready to have an aneurism.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: God, you sound like Rex. Do you want to die like him too? Will that make you happy?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Don't take it out on me because you feel guilty for what happened to Rex.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: okay, you two. That's enough. Pops, if they're staying, then we're staying.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: All right, room service!

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: I suggest we try to do everything we can to make sure we go home together. toe with Pops fumes working his jaw, standing toe to Speed.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Where's the Mach-5?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Logged with security.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: You added something to it?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Some defensive modifications.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: The whole thing's out of balance, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It pulls left, rides a little stiff.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Sparky. Pops and Sparky leave to do their work. Speed feels terrible. He looks at his Mom.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Your father loves you Speed. He's just afraid that--

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I know. It's gonna be okay.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: You wouldn't lie to your mother would you?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Never again. She hugs him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is later. he feels a A burly C.T.B. Man stands guarding a door when bee sting on his neck. to the The dart's poison acts quickly dropping the agent floor as a ninja emerges from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katsu sleeps soundly. Above him, in the shadows of the vaulted ceiling there is a flash, as a piece of metal glints against the moonlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another ninja crawls like a spider down to an. open window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sheer curtains undulate in the open window of Speed's room as a masked face lowers into view. The men of the Racer family lay scattered about the room in cots and on the couches. Mom and Trixie are in the connecting room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A liquid travels down a. wire that hangs poised about Katsu's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ninja enters Racer X's bedroom and sees him asleep in his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ninja creeps past the sleeping men to Speed's bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The oil drips onto Katsu's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blowgun is raised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing over Speed, the ninja withdraws a syringe from his hidden chest pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katsu licks his lips as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blowgun is fired, burying itself into the mound of pillows. Racer X, his face shrouded in shadows, emerges from the darkness where all marked men sleep, behind the couch. The ninja realizes he's been tricked and spins just as Racer X attacks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The syringe moves towards Speed's neck when-- Sprittle rolls over, knocking chim-chim with his arm, waking him up. and as soon as he sees the ninja-- He screams. Sprittle screams. The ninja attacks stabbing at Speed who just barely catches the needle. The ninja tries to wing-chun the hypodermic free but-- Speed is too quick and he forces the needle into the headboard as-- Sparky jumps onto the ninja's back.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: I got him! I got hiiiyow-- The ninja throws Sparky across the room and tries to bolt but Speed is up and throwing a quick combo. The ninja stumbles, but a manages a spin-kick that knocks Speed back as-- Pops grabs the ninja from behind.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: You attack my family?1 You try to hurt my son?! Pops twists the squirming ninja through a series of wrestling moves-- Finishing the ninja in a spinning over head helicopter---

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Launching him out the window. Trixie and Mom burst in from the adjoining room.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Oh my god? Was that a ninja? Pops cracks his knuckles.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: More like a non-ja. Terrible what passes for a ninja these days. s still She looks out the window and smiles; this family' got it.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Cool beans. There is a hurried knock at the door.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: I'll get it. It is Horuko, surrounded by security.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: Oh, I am sorry. I was looking for Speed Racer. Speed moves to the door.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Horuko? Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: No. Something terrible has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katsu can barely sit up, his arm draped over Horuko, his head lolling from side to side. The family is gathered around them and Racer X, who is again wearing the mask. Racer X tastes the needle of the blow dart.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Narcolyte Benzamine. A highly effective and debilitating drug. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stays in the system for hours, but leaves with no trace.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: I'll be...fine...by morning...

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: No you won't. You can't drive a car. You can barely stand up. Katsu leaps to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: You do not tell me what I can do-- He suddenly collapses to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: KATSUL
dialogues.text: She tries to help him, but he is unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What are we going to do? They all look to each other for an answer, but no one seems to have one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone wakes him and he grunts into the phone in indiscernible Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: MUSHI
dialogues.text: .I have been assured that our problem has been solved.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Perhaps your definition of "solved" is different from mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: d a In the distance, the medieval walled city sinks behin hill as the sunrises, the sound of rolling thunder swelling as-- The race cars come flying over the hill, exploding past us.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The second leg of the Casa Cristo is under way. And the stage is set for what might be one of the most ferocious rallies we've seen in years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowds lining the road cheer as the cars scream past. Already starting to nudge and buck, trying to force an early mistake,.Speed and Racer X are immediately forced into their aggressively defensive driving. Speed seems particularly wired.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Watch your line! Okamoto adjusts.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cut left! Now! Speed. flies into block for Okamoto, but Okamoto doesn't create enough space.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watch it! They kiss with the shriek of crashing metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops and Trixie ride in the helicopter with Sparky spotting.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Packs leaning left, look for a slingshot on the right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost on cue, the Medius Rez team launches at Okamoto, who feints left and jumps, allowing Speed to smash-block to the inside.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Speed, you're too tight! The cars bounce and Speed takes a hit, spinning for moment before he regains control. Speed mumbles to himself.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: This is completely--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Pops mumbles finishing Speed's thought.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Absolutely crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The security guard receives confirmation.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: The chopper is ready ma'am. Horuko is escorted out, surrounded by her security detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruncher's thug watches through binoculars as Horuko exits the hotel, then reports through his Bluetooth.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: She's leavin' da hotel now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky scouts the upcoming terrain.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Wicked sidewinder coming up. Watch the inside-out. Could get ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horuko is escorted to her waiting helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew of thugs negotiates the winding crowded. streets

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Yeah, boss. Signal's loud and clear. On the dash is a GPS map with a blinking signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain of jostling cars weave up the switchback with the violence of clattering pachinko balls.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: They're airborne? You're sure? Good. Double the guard for her arrival in Bartimaeus. I gave my word nothing would happen to his sister and I mean to keep it. The Inspector gets another call.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Inspector Detector..-.Mrs. Racer? What kind of emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter races across the scenic landscape. Inside the cockpit, the pilot sets the auto-pilot on and releases the stick. He stands and pulls out a gun. It is Cruncher Block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed is driving like a maniac.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Left! Drift tight! Tight! Okamoto looks like he's about to go over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pilot opens the door to the posh passenger cabin. The two security men go for their guns but Cruncher has the drop.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Don't do it! They raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On the ground! Now! They get on.the floor. Horuko stands and Cruncher whips his gun around to her.

dialogues.speaker: GOTCHA--
dialogues.text: But suddenly, something is wrong, his eyes going wide as he realizes-- Horuko is not Horuko. Horuko is Katsu.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the-- Katsu snatches Cruncher's gun and the Fixer is too stunned to do anything to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You-cheater. The security team seizes hold of him.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But if you're here, who's--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katsu's car swerves wildly back into the middle of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trixie has had enough. She yanks up the dark visor on the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: That's better. Couldn't see anything. She gains control and eases the car into the slot.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: That's it. Nice line, Trix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horuko sits beside Sparky, wearing Trixie's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Top of the hill's coming. Snake's got at least a quarter mile'on ya.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Well, let's go get him.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: If you'd been a little more careful, he wouldn't be ahead of us.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I told you I couldn't see outta this dang helmet. It's too big.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I can't believe you talked us into this ridiculous idea.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: What's ridiculous about it? You're the one always telling me I'm a better driver than most of the WRL.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Now's not the time to prove it!

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It's too dangerous!

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Too dangerous for me but not for you?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Children, focus! If we're going to have a chance we're going to have to pass Snake before the rendezvous.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: I'm ready. Let's roll. She floors it, pulling out, leaving Speed shaking his head and trying to keep up. They smear through a hairpin turn and as they close on the nearest cars it is immediately apparent that they are no longer driving protectively or defensively-- They are attacking. Racer X leaps at the bumper of one car, corner-checking him into the rail while-- Trixie hits like a cue ball on the break, scattering several cars-- Leaving Speed little to clean up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky cheers.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Wahoo! Go get 'em, girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees them in the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE
dialogues.text: Here they come! Pick it up!

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Here comes the Okamoto team, making their move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every winding turn is another click on a fishing rod as they slowly reel the HydroCell team in. The Okamoto team moves with synchronized grace while Snake and his team struggle to hold their line.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE
dialogues.text: Watch it! What're you doin'?! The mountains undulate, the cars dip and rise caught in the current of this concrete river-- Flowing one way then another, the cars sawing across the belly of one bend, drifting into the curve of another

dialogues.speaker: UNTIL--
dialogues.text: The Hydrocell emerges over the crest of a hill with the Okamoto team tight to their bumpers.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just try it! Try to pass! Just try it! Racer X knows they're ready.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Take 'em.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: With pleasure. Speed slingshots from the back position, hurling alongside the HydroCell team until-- Snake blocks him, setting up an attack by one of his team but this just allows Racer X a hole to punch through. The cars continue to slug it out still weaving up the mountain road, climbing it seems to helicopter or blimp height.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Now the gloves are off and they are pounding one another, bumper to bumper, rail to rail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It remains at one level of intensity until--- Snakes bashes Trixie hard into the rail, driving her almost over the edge, causing her to shriek from the force of the blow-- And Speed loses it. His jaw clenches, shifting into a whole new level of intensity. He becomes a cyclone, a whirling dervish, enveloping the HydroCell team in a cloud of chaos--- Throwing, rending,. ripping through them until only Snake is left. Speed is not kind; battering him until he's not sure if he's going forward or backward. In a panic, Snakes reaches for a hidden lever but before he can take hold of it, Speed clobbers him again, causing him to shriek louder than Trixie and then-- Recede quickly away like a dog with its tail tightly tucked.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! Pops can't help a flash of delight.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: .that's my boy.

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: The Okamoto team roars into the lead behind some very aggressive driving by Speed Racer.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: You kiddin' me? He just tore Snake a new tailpipe!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Trix? You all right? She's obviously shaken up.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. 10--4 and ready for more. Speed shakes his head, wanting this to be over.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Then let's move it. We got some time to eat up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cruncher is buckled into a seat with his arms tied behind him. He glares at Katsu who is changing into his racing leathers.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Haven't ya heard? Cheaters never prosper.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Sir, we've got the lead! They're heading for the rendezvous, now! Katsu looks back at Cruncher and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. The thug hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Somethin' ain't right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head down towards the rendezvous which is a hidden alpine nook, surrounded by mountains.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: You're sure, no cameras here?

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Checked it this morning. Quite a few dead spots in these mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Okamoto team roars up to where everyone is waiting. Speed climbs out of the Mach-5 and heads straight for Trixie.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I told you-- She turns ready to fight, if that's what he wants.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You are one helluva driver. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: You're not so bad yourself. Sparky and Pops go to work, changing fuel cells and starting to pound out some of the serious dents. Racer X sees Cruncher guarded by the security team.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: What's he doing here?

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Stowaway. Weren't sure what to do with him.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Do what he'd do; break his legs and let him walk back. Horuko bows to Trixie.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: It was a blast.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Cells reloaded!

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Let's go! They start to turn until machine gun fires objects.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Nobody move! The thugs emerge from the surrounding wood.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What is this?!

dialogues.speaker: UP
dialogues.text: He strides towards the nearest goon but bullets spit

dialogues.speaker: IN
dialogues.text: the earth and snow at his feet causing him to freeze place.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: This is called a change of plan. Now freed, one of the thugs tosses him a gun.

dialogues.speaker: THUG
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. We're changing your plan that changed our plan to change your plan. - .right boss? Cruncher decides to ignore that.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: The new plan-- what was it, again? Break your legs, make you.walk back? I like that. He stands smiling in front of Racer X.

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But first, I think it's time to play a little peek-a-boo, I-see- you.

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: We are still waiting for the Okamoto team to come out of the pass.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Those roads can really ice up. Very dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the thugs pins Racer X's arms back as Cruncher goes for the mask while-- Unnoticed by anyone, the trunk of the Mach-5 pops open and four eyes peek out. Cruncher starts to peel back the mask when a rock clips him on the side of his head.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Monkey cookie! He turns just as-- Whap! A monkey cookie in the kisser.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice shot! Chim-chim howls as Sprittle reloads his sling-shot.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Sprittle?!

dialogues.speaker: CRUNCHER
dialogues.text: Get that monkey! The goons are confused, distracted, and before they can control it, the fight is on-- Racer X throws the thug holding him-- Speed and Trixie dish out equal measures of chop-socky and good of American slug-fu as-- Pops grapples and wrestles his goon into a head-lock. Racer X hammers Cruncher to the ground where he sees his gun, scrambling for it but just as he reaches for it-- Katsu steps on his hand. It's a short quick turn around and--

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Looks like another change of plan.

dialogues.speaker: WHILE
dialogues.text: The security guards herd up Cruncher and the thugs Pops turns his attention to--

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Sprittlel Get over here!

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Ahhhh! He and Chim-chim run behind Speed.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Sprittle this isn't a game. You could've been killed in there.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: I.know it was bad! I know we shouldn't have done it. But Chim- chim was really really scared.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Chim-chim?

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Okay, I was a little scared too.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Scared of what? Sprittle clings to his big brother.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: I didn't want what happened to Rex to happen to you. Racer X and Pops feel a hidden wound open.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We just thought if you got into trouble, maybe we could help and it's a good thing we did. a good Speed looks at Pops as if Sprittle is making point.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Oh no, you're not getting off that easy. If your mother hasn't had a heart attack already, I'm sure she'll know what to do with you two. tires and The last of Pops line is lost to the squeal of roar of engines as the HydroCell team flies by.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go! They rush to their cars, Speed leaping into the Mach-5. Engines. growl, tires spin and gravel spits as the three cars shoot back into the race.

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: First out of the pass is... the HydroCell team?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. They better send the emergency trailer--

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Wait! Is that-- Like eagles dropping from the sky, the Okamoto ream soars out of the mouth of the pass.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Here we go again.

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Whatever happened in that pass has left Okamoto back where they started but now only one obstacle stands between Snake oiler and

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: The Maltese Ice Caves.

dialogues.speaker: TNT. HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: Trixie notices as Pops begins to bite his lip. She whispers to Sparky.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: This is where Rex... Sparky nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moon-white sheaves mottled against coke-bottle colored ice floes rise up, a glistening wall of glacial plates surrounding the thin ribbon of road. Speed enters the first series of caves bored through earth and ice, a stroboscopic oscillation of light and dark, ads and no ads as--- The memory of watching Rex disappear down the throat of one of these caves haunts him.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Speed?! What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm fine. Ahead, the HydroCell team grows from small silhouettes flashing in and out of sight,. closer and closer, larger and larger until-- once more the three chase cars lock onto their rear bumper.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: The next cave's a rattler.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Double S.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: We'll make our move in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The open maw swallows the segmented train of cars, each one slipping down into an underworld--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Where there is no purchase for advertisements-- Only the cold, wet darkness where white lights chase after red ones. Speed tries to shake his fear when X calls for the attack.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Now. The cars split apart, Racer X leading the charge as-- Sparks flash as with the cross of swords, metal striking metal and-- The ice-crusted walls sparkle with star-bursts of

dialogues.speaker: VIOLENCE--
dialogues.text: The cacophony ringing through the first bending curve. It is obvious that the conditions are much more difficult, a sword fight on a frozen lake-- Each of the drivers, skidding, wobbling, drifting farther then they anticipated, but-- The Okamoto team are just too good, eliminating one and then the other HydroCell cars until-- Speed again has Snake in his sights. This time, though, Snake is ready.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE
dialogues.text: Not this time, punk! He throws the lever and beneath his car-- A violent spray of freezing gas immediately skim coats the road with a fresh shimmering glaze of ice that--- Speed hits going full throttle, immediately spinning wildly out of control. He screams trying to hold on as he spits out the end of the cave-- Smashing through the rail, separating from the earth-- Hanging for a moment against the soundlessness of the open sky-- Before dropping like a stone.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Speed!

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Oh no!

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Speed Racer's gone over the edge!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone feels the same stomach-lurching terror as Pops' eyes go wide with the terror that he is about to lose another son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed falls and from inside the cockpit it looks impossibly far to the bottom but-- The wall of the cliff is not completely vertical and the Mach-5 begins to rub against the ice. Speed reacts immediately, hitting one of the control buttons and-- Crampons shoot out of his tires, giving him just enough of a hold to try-- A split-jack jump, the front jacks firing, throwing the car into a somersault across the open ravine-- Slamming against the far side which has slightly more slope, allowing the crampons to dig in as-- He drive straight up the wall of ice. TNT. BLIMP.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: He did.not! He did not just do that!

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Speed Racer is. driving straight up a cliff face--are we getting this?

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: This kid is unbelievable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all cheer.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Go, Speed, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed jumps again, vaulting violently back into the winding road just behind a disbelieving Snake.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Hi. Remember me? Speed roars up after him and Snake grabs for his lever again but now it's Speed that's ready-- Jumping over the ice, he body slams Snake, sending him hard into the rail as Speed shoots into the lead.

dialogues.speaker: SNAKE
dialogues.text: Not again! Not again! He grabs at an ankle holster, yanking out a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their cameras zoom in as Snake aims.

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Oh my god, he's got a gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed doesn't notice until it seems his entire family screams into his ear--

dialogues.speaker: GUN
dialogues.text: Snakes fires just as-- Speed hits the cockpit bubble and the bullets smack against it like a sledgehammer into a brick wall.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He swerves knowing he won't be able to take many hits as Snake chases after him, firing as-- Speed hits the crampons again and runs up the side of the mountain then-- Flips off the wall just as the cliff face drops off, switching sides as-- Snake now finds himself on the outside as Speed bashes him out through the guard rail.
