Snake tries a similar move to Speed but Snake is no Speed And his car bursts apart as he miss-times the flip, sending a bouncing cocoon to the distant snows below.

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Snake oiler completely going out of his mind--

dialogues.speaker: JOHNNY
dialogues.text: Could have been altitude sickness, it gets crazy up there--

dialogues.speaker: CASA CRISTO ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Whatever it was, Speed handled it beautifully and with less than 250 kilometers to go, nothing seems to stand between Okamoto--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars weave through the Byzantine streets of San Bartimeaus.

dialogues.speaker: C.C. ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: -- And victory! The checkered flag comes down, hundreds of flashbulbs capturing the moment as Katsu leads Speed and Racer X across the finish line. INT. REMMINGTON'S OFFICE. Remmington smoulders like the cigar worries between his fingers as he watches the effect of the race happen almost immediately.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The stock of Okamoto engineering climbs two points.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Get me... Tetsuya Okamoto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Katsu poses with Speed and Racer X for photographers. Racer X is clearly not interested.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: We make a good team.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: We did our part. Make sure you do yours. Racer X stares at Katsu whose face is as expressionless as a mask but it feels as though Racer X can see right through it.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Congratulations Mr. Okamoto. Very impressive race.

dialogues.speaker: OKAMOTO
dialogues.text: Yes, thank you. You are very generous, Mr. Remmington.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 2
dialogues.text: Speed, does this mean you've signed with Okamoto?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Uh, no. This was... a mutually beneficial opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: Yes, well put.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER 3
dialogues.text: Katsu, does this mean you will be running in the Grand Prix this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: KATSU
dialogues.text: We'll see. Right now I'm just going to enjoy this victory.

dialogues.speaker: OKAMOTO
dialogues.text: The price is 78 a share.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: That's outrageous! The price is barely above 50! This is extortion! Blackmail! I'll sue you! Tie up every asset you own up for the next 20 years!

dialogues.speaker: OKAMOTO
dialogues.text: As you wish Mr. Remmington. Have a nice day.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Wait! He grinds his molars until they are smooth.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seventy-eight a share. I'll have the papers drawn up.

dialogues.speaker: OKAMOTO
dialogues.text: A pleasure doing business with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sit across Okamoto hangs up the phone. Katsu and Horuko from him. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: OKAMOTO
dialogues.text: You have done very well for us, my son. Katsu smiles the same smile as his father. The only person not smiling in the room is Horuko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed kicks over a tool box giving voice to his rage with a cacophony of clattering metal. He jumps into the Mach 5. The engine guns the wheels screech as he peels out and away leaving-- Inspector Detector standing with this hat in hand, his frown mirrored by Pops.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: I don't get it. What just happened? POPS. Okamoto played us for chumps. All he wanted was our help to drive up the stock on his family's company. Even if there was a file, he had no intention of turning it over.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: You mean that whole race was for nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed screams as loud as he can strangling the steering wheel as he rockets through a series of familiar with curves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without the lights or banners or crowds, the race track echoes with the same quiet portance as a cathedral. It is here that Speed has always found himself. But as he sails through neck snapping turns with reckless abandon, it becomes clear that he is chasing something that he has lost. He seems ready to cry for all the frustration and anger, wanting so badly to undo the last few weeks of his life. Suddenly in his rearview mirror there is an answer to his prayer, a miracle-- His brother.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: For a moment he believes that he is again driving beside the ghost of his brother but when the two cars kiss up against each other, Speed realizes this is no ghost-- It's Racer X. The masked Racer suddenly becomes the focus of all his anger and Speed swings his car, wielding it like a club, trying to clobber him. Racer X dodges the first blow and swings back, the two ha at one another, banging, shoving one another into the wal Until Speed can't take it anymore and he goes at X as ferociously as he can, throwing him into a tailspin-- Crashing him into one of the grand stands. Silence embraces the track. Speed climbs out of the Mach 5.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: X? Racer X? There is a small movement in the car, a shuddering as though in pain and Speed realizes he may have gone too far.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Racer X?!! He runs to the car but immediately stops when he realizes the masked man is not in pan; he is laughing. He practically falls out of his car.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Jeezus, kid. You can drive. I haven't been thrown like that in years.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: The inspector told me what happened., I came looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Thought you'd take it hard and maybe do something stupid.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Why would you care?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Because you're a fighter. And a friend.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Why don't you just tell me the truth? Racer X stares at him hard.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're Rex, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: You mean your brother?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Youfirstappeared two years after Rexdied.You drive just like him.Youknew I'd be here because thisis where he always used to takeme.Just tell me the truth. mask. After a long hard moment, Racer X pulls off his He is not Rex. Speed is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're... not Rex.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: No. I'm sorry Speed but your brother is dead. He pulls his mask back on.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Don't be. I'm sure where ever your brother is, he is immensely proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: For what? Making the same mistakes he did?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: For trying to make a difference. From what I've read, that's all he tried to do.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: And what good did it do? He got killed for nothing. Racing hasn't changed and it never will!

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter if racing never changes. What matters is if we let racing change us. Everyone of us has to find the reason to do this. You don't climb into a T- 180 to be a driver. You do it because you're driven.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I don't know why I'm doing it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: That's obvious. At Fuji, you were trying to prove something. At Cristo, you were looking for justice. Neither are the reason you belong behind a steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: If you know so much, why don't you tell me why I should keep driving?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Sorry. That's for you to figure out. He climbs back into his car.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I just hope when you do, I'm there. to see it. He roars away leaving Speed alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed is furiously packing. There is a knock on the door but he ignores it. Sprittle opens the door, Chim-chim following him in.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Hey watcha doin?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What's it look like?

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Where ya goin?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I don't know. I just gotta get away from here.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Because.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Because why?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Because I have to.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Can we come with you? Speed is struck by an odd sense of deja vu.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Can we come with you?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: You'll understand when it's your turn. He shoulders his bag and shoves out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there, Speed crosses to the door but Pops is already sitting, waiting, a heaviness in his.limbs.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Speed, before you go, I'd like to say a few things. Will you sit with your old man for a minute? Speed chafes a bit but drops his bag.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Don't try to stop me.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: I won't. I made a mistake trying to tell you what to do at Cortega. You were right. I was wrong. I won't make that mistake again. Speed sits.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to know that I acted rashly. I said things I wish I hadn't. Your mother usually protects me from making an ass out of my self but I was determined to do it this time and I guess I did a pretty good job of it. I wanted to make sure you understood how sorry I was.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: The truth was, I couldn't have been more proud of you son. Not because you won, but because you stood up, you weren't afraid and you did what you thought was right.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: So? It didn't amount to anything. It was completely meaningless.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: How could it be meaningless? I saw my son become a man. I watched him act with courage and integrity and drive the pants off of every driver on the road. This is not meaningless. This is the reason for a father's life. Pop's eyes'begin to twinkle with tears

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I admit I went to Cortega because I was afraid that what happened to Rex was going to happen to you. And I just couldn't take that. I couldn't loose another one of my boys like that again. But what I realize in Cortega was that I didn't lose Rex when he crashed, I lost him here. I lost him when he walked out of this house and I let him go without telling him how proud I was of him and how much I loved him. I let him think that a stupid motor company meant more to me than he did. You'll never know how much I regret that mistake, but it's enough that I'll never make it again. He puts his big bear arms around him and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you Speed. I understand that every child leaves home but I want you to know that door is always open and you can always come back.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I love you Pops. I'm just so confused right now. I don't what I'm doing or why I'm doing it. I'm locked up in some kinda tailspin and no direction makes sense.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: I know what that's like. When Rex died I didn't even. know if I wanted salt on my eggs, let alone if I wanted to keep building cars. Then, do you remember when we sat here, that night, watching old Ben Burns and Dugazi? You remember that? Speednods vaguely.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sittin' here, cheering with you, something just clicked, like a light being switched on inside of me and after that, I never had trouble remembering how I liked me eggs.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Jeez Pops. That's just it. That's part of my problem.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: That race. The '43 Prix. Burns and Dugazi? It was fixed. Remmington told me the whole story. It was all about some DNF names Rotts. They've known the winner of every Grand Prix for the past 50 years. It's always fixed. That's a tough pill for Pops to swallow.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: I don't believe that. Remmington's a crook. You can't believe a crook.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I don't think he was lying, Pops.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: The Grand Prix? A sham? Ding dong.

dialogues.speaker: POPS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who could that be?

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: Speed opens the door. She seems to glow, radiating her own incandescence.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Horuko?!

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: Forgive me for intruding but I had to come before it was too late. Speed eyes her for a moment wondering if this is another set-up.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is not a trick. I swear to you. I am not my brother.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: You going to ask the lovely lady in?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. Come on in. She steps in, looking somewhat out of place in the suburban living room.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Can I get you something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: No. My security man believes I am still at the opera, so I only have a moment. She turns to Speed.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I am very sorry for what happened. what my father and brother did was not right and I am ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: It's fine. Just another lesson learned.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: No.. It is they who are in need of a lesson. She pulls an envelope out of her bag and gives it to Speed.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This rightfully belongs to you. He opens the envelope and his eyes immediately light up.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: An invitation to compete in the 91st annual Grand Prix?

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: My brother was planning to decline anyway but I studied the rules very carefully and as a member of the Okamoto team, if you present this invitation on the day of the race, they must allow you to compete. Pops bursts into a smile and slaps Speed on the back.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Whaddya think of that, Mr. Its- Always-Fixed?

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: You do not have to say anything. I only hope you drive as you did in Casa Cristo and you wipe the smiles from their faces.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: We don't have a car. Sparky!

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Right here Pops. Sparky steps out of the kitchen doorway.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: What're you doing in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Same as everyone else. Behind him the entire family peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I don't believe it. You were listening the whole time? Trixie goes to him.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: We were worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: HORUKO
dialogues.text: I would say good luck Saturday but you do not need it. You are already very lucky to have such a family.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Goodbye and thank you. He closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Come on! We got work to do.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: But Pops, the race is less than 36 hours away.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Isn't that how fast Remmington said he could build that tin can with all his fancy machines?

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Then we'll do it in 32. Let's go! He heads for the garage, Sprittle leaping after him.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: I want to help.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Well come on.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Chim-chim too?

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: We need everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family gets to work, bolting, welding, drilling, cutting, and grinding. The framework of a car begins to materialize, assembled it seems out of thin air, human will made manifest as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car is covered in a sheet bearing the RI logo. Remmington speaks before Mushi and his cadre of lawyers and assistants.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I swear to you Mr. Mushi when the GRX is revealed at the Grand Prix and then captures the black and white checkers the demand for our transponder engines will go through the roof. Mushi.smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Racers continue to work, Sparky beginning to fall asleep just as Mom brings him a big, steaming cup of coffee. The car is further along, but still a long way from finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papers are signed. Hands are shaken. Pictures posed for. The harmony of the corpratocracy complete as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire family, covered in sweat, blood, and grease, refusing to quit even as the sun rises on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing we've seen compares to the staggering scope of this track. It feels like an entire city; grand stands rising up like can-opened sky scrapers surrounded by clover leafs of track that seem like origami folded highways. Preparations are well under way, ads being positioned, lights being checked, make-up being applied to Ben Burns and his announcing partner, Cass Jones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Racers gobble handful of potato chips, stuffing quarters of P,B, & J sandwiches into their mouths, rushing to finish while--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caviar, shrimp and lobster are being set out on trays of ice beneath a glistening ice sculpture of.the GRX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is nearly finished,Pops spraying on the paint as-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowds have already begun to arrive. At the players entrance, fans swarm after Cannonball Taylor who arrives in his gorgeous sports car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sparky slams the access panel shut.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Alright, fire it up! Everyone holds their breath as Speed hits the ignition. The car makes a sick baying rattle and smoke begins pouring out of the engine.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kill it! Kill it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington stands ready to reveal the GRX.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, behold the future. It's black, shiny, and beautiful in a malefic way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock continues to tick, everyone watching anxiously over his shoulder as Sparky works.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Sparks, it's getting late.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: I know, I know. Okay. Give it a try. Everyone braces as Speed hits the ignition. It is the sound of an explosion held in the palm of your hand.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Sounds beefy Pops.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: It gives you a little something extra.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Let's get it loaded!

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: This year marks a new record as the Grand Prix will be broadcast in eighty-four different languages. The camera pans. over the multitude of ethnic broadcasters.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just gets bigger every year, doesn't it Ben?

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Seems like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elite hobnob, champagne flutes flashing between feathered hats and waxy smiles. The Okamotos raise their glasses to Mushi.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: We've got an incredible lineup this year. Some major competition. We got a few fan favorites like the Gray Ghost, Sonic "Boom-boom" Renaldi and Prince Kabala. We got perenial powerhouses like Nitro Venderhoss, Gary "Gearbox" Kalinkov, and Mori Minimoto.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Not to mention C ball.

dialogues.speaker: FUJI ANNOUNCER
dialogues.text: Cannonball Taylor, fastest Grand Prix seed in history, driving the new ORX from Remmington Racecars.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: She looks mighty tight. FUJI ANNOUNCER. There is an odd numbered field today, nineteen, one shy of a full boat as Katsu Okamoto declined his automatic invitation after winning the Casa Cristo.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Hey there's something going on down there.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: We're seeing some kind of commotion down at the trailer entrance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large group of security officials are gathered, staring at the invitation in Speed's hand. One of them starts to shake his head when he hears--

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: Is there a problem here, officer?

dialogues.speaker: TNT. GRAND PRIX PENTHOUSE
dialogues.text: Remmington is in his element, everything seeming to go exactly as planned until Gennie comes up behind him and whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: GENNIE
dialogues.text: Sir, we have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors burst open as Remmington charges in. His eyes flash as though seeing ghosts when confronted by the entire Racer clan.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: What madness is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: SENIOR RACE OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Mr. Remmington, this is a legitimate invitation. We have verified it.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Where did you get that?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I was on the Okamoto team remember? I won it fair and square.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: This is preposterous! He can't be allowed to race. It's too late.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: The ruling on this is quite clear. Try to stop it and you'll be in blatant violation of the WRL charter, leaving me no option but to shut this years Prix down until a full investigation can be completed.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: What?! Do you have any idea what that would cost? Are you insane?

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: Try me. Remmington stews then spits a threat at Speed.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: You'll regret this.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Something big is going on because every race official has been-- wait, wait. An announcement is being made. A new driver is being added to the field.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Holy sh--

dialogues.speaker: BLEEP.
dialogues.text: Ben Burns gets bleeped by the network censors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A name flashes on as the driver is added.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE ANNOUNCER VOICE
dialogues.text: Now driving in the twentieth and final position, Speed Racer. The roar from the crowd shakes the windows of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Concerned, knitted brows search the room in quiet panic while in private-- Horuko allows herself the faintest smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington meets in secret with Cannonball Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: A million dollars to the driver that takes Racer out.

dialogues.speaker: CANNONBALL
dialogues.text: He won't get out of the blocks.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: I prefer him to not even make it out of the locker room. Cannonball smiles as Remmington starts to turn.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're installing a spear hook on the GRX.

dialogues.speaker: CANNONBALL
dialogues.text: I don't need one to beat that punk.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: A precaution.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed begins laying out all of his things while the other drivers move around him, wolves stalking prey. In a mirror, a Yakuza tattooed driver eyes Speed while drawing a straight razor up his neck. Speed tries to ignore him, digging through his bag, getting more and more flustered until he realizes-- He forgot the red socks.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Racer family finds their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yukuza man moves up behind a despairing Speed, straight razor flashing as-- The Gray Ghost cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: Hey kid--

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: The Gray Ghost...

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: Just wanted to say good luck. He reaches out to shake, then whispers.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's a million dollar bounty on your head.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: A million dollars? Wow. Maybe I should take myself out.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: Watch yourself. Your ruffling some pretty major feathers here.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Why aren't you after the bounty?

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: Our little dance at Fuji--that's how it should always be.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: As the cars take to the field you can feel the anticipation mounting in the audience. Something is different. There is an electricity in the air. The presence of Speed Racer has completely changed the equation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed is sitting, still not dressed. The broken ritual has him confused, not sure how to begin. A dressed and helmeted driver heads straight at him but is diverted by--

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Speed Racer? Speed turns, taking a moment to realize the handsome millionaire playboy in the tux is unmasked Racer X. He glances down at Speed's belongings and sees a picture of Rex.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYBOY/RACER X
dialogues.text: I'm quite a fan of yours and just wanted to say how glad I am to see you here. As they shake hands, Racer X realizes that something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYBOY/RACER X, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: I just... I got this thing... its stupid, I know, a superstition, but I guess all of us got one.

dialogues.speaker: PLAYBOY/RACER X
dialogues.text: Can I help? Speed suddenly notices the red trim of his tuxedo and his red tie. He looks down and heaves a sigh of relief. Red socks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed rushes out of the darkness of the tunnel into the brightly colored, awe-inspiring venue that is the Grand Priz Coliseum. There is a dizzying onslaught of giant advertisements and jumbotrons while the enormous crowd roars in lapping waves like the surrounding ocean.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: There he is now, Speed Racer, perhaps the biggest wild card in Grand Prix history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floating camera blimps seem to hover everywhere including right next to Speed-- Catching him unawares with a gaper's mouth. The image of Speed looking overwhelmed is immediately broadcast onto the jumbotrons eliciting a laugh from the crowds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trixie sees Speed on the big screens.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Look! There's Speed!

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Speed Racer gets his first eyeful of the Coliseum.

dialogues.speaker: BEN
dialogues.text: This ain't Kansas baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gorgeous Prince Kabala struts for the crowd while a team of beautiful female mechanics push his jewel encrusted car into place. He sees Speed helping Sparky push the Mach 5 into place.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE
dialogues.text: Hey, mouth-breather, get used to

dialogues.speaker: THIS--
dialogues.text: He shows Speed his ass.

dialogues.speaker: PRINCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: 'Cause that's what you're going to be looking at all day! Speed tries to ignore him and the other driver's staring at him like a fox staring at a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Howya feelin'? Speed takes a breath as he dares to look around again.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: .it's big.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Hey, this cockpit is the exact same size it was at Thunderhead.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Just wanted to say, thanks, for what could be the most exciting moment of my life.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Couldn't have gotten here without you. He hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: I'm looking forward to that cold milk.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Me too. Speed climbs in as the speaker system blares--

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE ANNOUNCER VOICE
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, start your engines. The engines erupt, crashing against the waves of the roaring crowd but-- Inside the Mach 5 everything goes completely silent. Nothing exists now for Speed except the track as he loses all separation between himself and his car. He takes a deep breath and closes his eyes as the countdown begins.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: The final countdown has begun and a stillness has fallen over this stadium as all eyes turn to one car.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: This ain't a race. It's a showdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again we cut to the many varied expressions of anticipation: Trixie, Mushi, Okamoto, Sprittle, and Chim- chim, Katsu and Horuko, Mom and Pops, Remmington and Racer X who no longer has any socks, until-- The gun sounds-- The cars become bullets hurdled forward, except for the car in front of Speed which barely moves blocking his

dialogues.speaker: PATH--
dialogues.text: He tries to avoid it but can't, rear-ending him while the car behind him slams into the back of the Mach 5.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Trouble at the start, a misfire traps Speed Racer, causing a

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Uh-oh. Look out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car to the side swerves aiming straight at Speed who manages at the last second a slip-jack jump-- Flipping over the car as it slams into the pile-up while- Speed guns his engine in the air so that when he hits the track there is a scream of burning rubber and the Mach 5 rockets out of the start to the cheering crowd.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: I don't know how he got out of that one--

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: That-kid's wiley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first lap of the Grand Prix is Ben Hur brutal as car after car takes a shot at Speed but-- He uses their aggressiveness throwing them into each othe Littering the track with flaming debris and bouncing cocoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They try to keep up but Speed is even too fast for them.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Speed fakes left, jumps right--

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Nice, nice--

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: He slips in behind Gearbox---

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Here comes over under--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed executes another beautiful maneuver sending Gearbox crashing into Boom-Boom-- Both cars going boom-boom, their rubber cocoons bouncing free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben Burns is giddy with glee.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: I told you! I told you!

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Speed Racer seems unstoppable, moving up from dead last, nearing the leaders as they head into the slalom with the Gray Ghost battling Prince Kabala and Cannonball Taylor for the lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prince tries to sight the Ghost in his mirrors but the Gray Ghost seems to vanish.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: Where am I? Where am I? I'm here. I am over there. I'm Savior Faire! The Prince tries to block the Ghost but he can't seem to locate him.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm everywhere, baby! Wham! The Ghost is on him, pouncing, slipping into what feels like a shoulder throw that sends the Prince spinning out of control onto the onrushing Nitro-- Shattering the Prince's car like a mis-struck diamond reduced in one hammer stroke to twinkling dust.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The two more cocoons bounce onto the road as the other cars roar past.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: A spectacular crash as the Prince's jewel-covered Gigerbon worth an estimated 22 million dollars is scattered over a quarter mile of track.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: I'd like to work clean up on that crash. They chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: But look out, as they approach the Big Drop, here comes Speed Racer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars head over as though falling off the end of Niagara and while other drivers cling to their steering wheels just trying to hang on-- Speed presses the accelerator, making his move-- Banking higher than anyone up the big wall and when he dives back down there are only three cars left ahead of

dialogues.speaker: HIM--
dialogues.text: The green Mushi motors car, the Gray Ghost, and the Black GRX.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Speed Racer is knocking on the door of the new GRX driven by Cannonball Taylor.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: You hoot Anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Ok Mr. Two Time Grand Prix, Five time WRL, future Hall of Fame, teach me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed makes a move and Cannonball blocks, but it is clumsy and Speed quickly counters-- Bouncing Cannonball into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Come on! Is that it? He swerves back and the two cars begin to battle but it is immediately clear who is the better driver, as-- Speed throws Cannonball from one side of the track to the other.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Cannonball Taylor is in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Tear `em up kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knuckles of Remmington's fist crackle as he wrings the tension.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Do it. Stop him. Stop him now.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Lesson's over. See you at the finish line. Speed slides into Cannonball to throw him but as he does-

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Cannonball throws a hidden switch and under the two cars a spear hook shoots out and locks onto the Mach 5 undercarriage. Speed feels it and knows what happened immediately.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: Spear hook! He's got me! Cannonball slows driving both cars into the wall, grinding against the Mach 5 while the trailing cars shoot post.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Cannonball has Speed pinned as they grind through the butterfly turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington relaxes as Speed falls further off the leader pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sprittle understands immediately what is going on.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: That cheater! He's using a spear hook! SPEAR HOOK! SPEAR HOOK! The surrounding crowd becomes uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Sprittle, we don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: I do! Cannonball Taylor is nothing but a big cheater!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They exit the butterfly turn and head into the slalom, both drivers fighting hard to force the other into the onrushing concrete pylons. The paint is scraped first from the outside of the Mach 5 and then the GRX as they barely avoid one pylon and then another, neither car gaining an advantage until-- The Mach 5 begins to rattle, the stronger GRX taking advantage as they head for the final pylon--- Where the camera that is broadcasting the two cars onto the jumbo-tron is positioned.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: This is going to be ugly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the last second, Speed hits the two outside jacks causing both cars to rise up onto the two outside wheels of the GRX-- Revealing the undercarriage and the hidden spear hook to the camera. The crowd gasps.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Told you so! Chim-chim high fives him.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cheaters never prosper!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mach 5 flips down, pancaking the GRX, while the Mach 5 crashes free, leaving the exposed spear hook to hang limply from the front of the GRX.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Cannonball clearly using a spear hook.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: That could cost him the Hall of Fame.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Not to mention what it might do to Remmington Industries.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Shame on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People begin drifting away from Remmington as he feels the walls close in around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: switch but Speed tries to start the Mach 5. He hits the the starter only grinds.

dialogues.speaker: SPARKY
dialogues.text: Oh no, come on, don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops watches through his binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: POPS
dialogues.text: Don't quit on us now baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racer X is watching with Minx.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: Careful. Listen to it. Don't kill the starter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed takes a deep breath and it seems the entire stadium takes it with him. He closes his eyes and tries to listen to the car.

dialogues.speaker: SPEED
dialogues.text: What do you need? Something makes him put the car in second gear. He steps on the accelerator, then hits the starter and--- And the Mach 5 roars to life. The crowd screams to the wail of burning rubber.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: He's back in it, but less than a lap and a half, I don't know what kind of chance he has.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Come on kid! Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red socks flash as Speed stomps on it, jamming the accelerator to the floor. He's a half-lap behind the entire field but every eye in the stadium is on the white and red streak of lightening as it-- Thunders by, rattling the elaborate lace work of concrete and steel-- Gaining, inch by inch, foot by foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People abandon the televised images, wanting to watch this miracle, to see it with their own eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: Look at the split! He's shattering the lap record.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: Don't mean a thing without those checkers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed comes out of the spiral, glimpsing the back of the trailers as they go over the Big Drop. Where they ease over the edge, Speed hurls out, going airborne, free-falling past two trailers, as-- The grade of the slope reaches up and gently eases the Mach 5 back onto the track, to the delight of the crowd. The Mach 5 surfs up the big bank, weaving through another pair that try to stop him with spectacularly disastrous results. outside the Mach 5 a maelstrom of violent chaos churns

dialogues.speaker: WHILE--
dialogues.text: Inside, Speed is perfectly at pease.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: No hesitation, nothing fazes him, no one seems capable of stopping him.

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: This kid ain't just driving--he's on a mission.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington can't take it, losing all pretense of decorum.

dialogues.speaker: REMMINGTON
dialogues.text: Stop him! Stop him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed weaves through the butterfly cloverleaf, taking each turn at such intense speeds that the cars he passes seem to be moving in slow motion. By the end of the slalom, he is back where he left off, with two cars left ahead of him-- Mushi motors and the Gray Ghost.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: Welcome back kid. Been lonely up here without you.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: With a quarter lap to go Speed Racer is back, two cars beneath him and destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speed suddenly feels the weight of everything that has brought him. to this point. He. sees images and hears voices, flashing through his head, as though at his own death. The montage finishes with the image of Speed as a ten year old boy, drawing pictures of race cars, making all the noises, lost in a dreamworld that has become reality. He sees the finish line and makes his move. The Gray Ghost sees it coming first.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, here we go, here we go. Speed flashes one way, then another, moving in ghost-like feigns, here there, and everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: GRAY GHOST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's this? What's this? Hey now! That's my move! Before Ghost knows where to go, Speed ducks past--

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sling-shotting down alongside the Mushi motors car. The Yukuza driver tries to block but-- Speed jumps, dodging the hit, causing the Mushi car to swerve and then wildly correct-- Swinging back as Speed hop-scotches over him again, just

dialogues.speaker: AS--
dialogues.text: The Ghost flies in, taking a broadside hit from the Mushi car, both of them exploding just feet from the finish line, as-- Speed launches up and through the cloud of smoke and fire, crossing into history with the flashing wave of the checkered black and white-- Fluttering softly in the silence as the crowd begins to rise to their feet. The Mach 5 slides to a stop and for a moment Speed catches his breath, then, slowly pulling off his helmet he begins to let it all in-- The thunder of the crowd can be felt through his chest straight to his heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remmington screams, overturning a table of caviar and lobster, crashing the elaborate ice sculpture of the GRX at the feet of Mushi who turns and walks away in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pops' chest is out, tears running down to his moustache as he wraps his arms around Mom, who goes to pieces as Chim-chim and Sprittle leap up and down, hugging Trixie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smiles of Katsu and his father are gone giving Horuko no end of secret joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd storms over the barriers, swarming Speed and the Mach 5.

dialogues.speaker: CASS JONES
dialogues.text: It's a pandemonium! People have gone completely crazy! In fourteen years we've never seen anything like this!

dialogues.speaker: BEN BURNS
dialogues.text: It's a whole new world baby, a whole new world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd lifts Speed up onto their shoulders as we collage-pan to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Racer X watching his brother, a smile on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: He did it. Racer X lowers his binos and turns to the inspector.

dialogues.speaker: RACER
dialogues.text: Yes, he did.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: This could change everything.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: It already has.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: My men are bringing the family down. Do you want to go with them?

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: He turns and takes Minx by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: INSPECTOR DETECTOR
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question? Do you ever think you made a mistake, hiding the truth from them?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is a flash of images as we glimpse the truth; images of Rex watching his car explode in the ice caves, his funeral, then the facial surgery, then the mask of bandages as one face is lost in a mirror and another is revealed.

dialogues.speaker: RACER X
dialogues.text: If I did, then it's a mistake I have to live with. He walks away while---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several of the other driver's led by the Gray Ghost applaud and salute Speed as-- The Racer family is led through the swarm of photographers and fans.

dialogues.speaker: TRIXIE
dialogues.text: Speed! She pushes towards him and he sweeps her up into his arms and kisses her, surrounded by the sparkle of camera flash

dialogues.speaker: AS---
dialogues.text: Sprittle covers Chim-chim's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: SPRITTLE
dialogues.text: Danger. May cause cookies. Mom and Pops both hug Speed, their eyes bright with joy

dialogues.speaker: AS--
dialogues.text: We rise up, up, and away. Roll snazzy credits.
